Do you have any idea how difficult that makes it to concentrate on the whole purpose of using your app?? It's overstimulating. I feel like I'm seeing more ads than actual content. Shouldn't have to dig for gold to spot the few actual pins! Ridiculous. End of an era if you don't cut them down, devs.

I hate that everything is video and is constantly playing. I cant browse in peace. I wish there was an option for a "classic" version. One where there are more photos pinned instead of annoying videos, where everything isnt an ad that takes me to store site, where I can click on the pic and it takes me to the site it was pinned from, not a picture search. I havent used the app in ages. I just tried today and got so bummed over it I had to make a review. Im sure the creators could care less.

I'm giving this 2 stars for two reasons. Reason 1: they show ads with false advertisement , and when you report it, they review it and take no action. I ordered a welder that turned out to be a soldering iron. The photos didn't even match what was sent. I reported it, they took no action. I appealed it, and they still took no action. Reason 2: the latest update makes it so that to open Amazon links from the Pinterest app, it requires giving Pinterest permissions to your Amazon account. No.

There are more ads than pins. Literally, I counted. This is just the tip of the iceberg of what's wrong with this app. I am back 1 year and 3 months later and the app is now completely unusable. I am only able to click on ONE single pin on my feed before the whole thing refreshes. Yes, you heard that right. I go into the app and I can't even look at my curated pins before they are taken away from me!!! To be able to find pins in your history, you have to CLICK on them first! I can't!!

With the most recent update, I'm experiencing "scrolling drift" (up and down) that appears to be caused by the appearance of even more ads shoving actual content up or down, out of view. It makes me accidentally click on ads I had no intention of clicking on. I don't mind seeing ads, but they're getting in the way of viewing content, aggressively at this point. A fix would be appreciated.

I'm not fond of the updates, makes it a little harder on my phone to follow just one board, and its gets annoying enough for me to just stop using most of the time. Most of my saves now come from other sites...**(10/20/25...original review in '22)been a few years, but still not super fond of these newer updates either, or being told they got rid of pins, esp when I've no clue what they wereü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

I wish I could give a lower rate than one star! I used to love this app, today I deleted it! I have been getting multipul posts wrongly blocked every month (What about an egg recipe is adult content!) without a reasonable way to contest or object. I was not even allowed to see the pins in question until it was reinstated (if it was) and every last one has been wrongfully flagged. there is no customer service option and there are now some times as many as 5 adds for every post. I've had enough!

Updating this one star review. Pinterest is not what it used to be. It's all AI and theres more ads than art. Most annoyingly, they report pins that you save and send YOU the warning as if YOU are the original poster. What other social media platform punishes the reposter rather than the original poster? It makes no sense. Stop trying to get me in trouble or threaten to deactivate my account for posts you allowed on your app in the first place.

It's good!! I see no reason for anyone NOT to install it! Though, Pintrest needs more diversity in its report button. since there is a lot of art on this platform, it needs more art-based report options! I see too much fanart that isn't appropriate, but because it isn't nudity, and they're often fictional characters (anime characters) I don't know which option to use. For example. I see FAR TOO MUCH art of Rin Okumura being shipped (relationship) with Yukio Okumura, they are BROTHERS.

80% of my feed is now ads. When scrolling down, there is 1 actual content surrounded by ads on all sides. It's ridiculous and the only feedback they've asked for is if I've noticed a certain brand in the ads. I loved the app and its user friendly interface and prefer it over instagram. And I have so many pins saved over the years that I'd hate to see this app continuing to go downhill.

Used to be great, but it's falling down hard. Many commercials are from dropshipping companies, sometimes entire pages are just commercials and it has become very hard to talk to other ppl as many things get randomly blocked, ppl included. (Dropshipping companies don't btw.) A lot, and i mean aprox 50% is ai made and fake. It's cool for learning skills like crochet, but i think it's on its last legs. I don't see it existing another 10 years if things don't change back at least somewhat.

absolutely fantastic from getting inspiration or references for various things, but the ads are just WAY too much. I am not joking when I say I get more "sponsored" ads than I do regular recommendations. freshly opened app.. I counted 14 or more ads compared to 4 actual recommendations. and reporting them as spam, inappropriate, or simply unwanted, does nothing. it's very unenjoyable when you're scrolling through more ads than stuff you're actually interested in.

title: Claude by Anthropic
description:
There's never been a better time to have a problem. Meet Claude, your AI problem solver and thinking partner. Claude works with you to write, research, code, and tackle complex problems with depth and precision. It enhances your thinking and expands what you're capable of, right from your phone

AI WRITING ASSISTANT

Turn rough ideas into polished content through collaborative refinement. Claude is your AI writing assistant and content editor that works with you to develop social media posts, professional emails, and complex reports. Together, you'll explore tone, structure, and clarity‚Äîiterating until your voice comes through clearly.


RESEARCH AND DATA INSIGHTS

Dig deeper into questions that matter. Claude helps you explore research angles, compile findings, and analyze data to surface meaningful insights. Search across Google Drive, Gmail, Calendar, and the web with accurate citations. Whether you're conducting business analysis, building reports, or generating ideas, Claude is the AI research assistant that thinks through problems with you‚Äîfrom initial questions to breakthrough discoveries.


AI CODING AND PROGRAMMING HELP

Your collaborative AI coding assistant for building better solutions. Work with Claude to review code, debug complex issues, and explore new programming languages. Claude walks through concepts and solutions together with you, helping you understand the "why" behind the code‚Äîwhether you're working in Python, JavaScript, React, or dozens of other languages.


VISUAL ANALYSIS

Upload photos, PDFs, or screenshots to explore visual content together. Claude provides AI visual analysis to help you extract text, translate languages, interpret charts and graphs, and evaluate UI layouts or technical diagrams. Get collaborative feedback on app designs and data visualizations. Generate SVG code for simple graphics and illustrations, working iteratively to refine visual solutions.


NO TYPING NEEDED

Think out loud with voice. Use Claude as your AI voice assistant to dictate in multiple languages‚Äîperfect for brainstorming sessions or working through ideas on the go.


EXPAND WHAT YOU CAN DO

Tackle projects beyond your current expertise. Whether you're learning a new skill, exploring unfamiliar domains, or working through complex challenges, Claude collaborates with you to push past your comfort zone and reach new capabilities.


Claude helps you:

‚ñ∂ Develop and refine content with AI writing
‚ñ∂ Work through meeting notes to surface key insights
‚ñ∂ Build reports and marketing content iteratively
‚ñ∂ Explore complex math problems with step-by-step reasoning
‚ñ∂ Plan projects, structure ideas, and develop flowcharts together
‚ñ∂ Translate between 100+ languages with nuance and context
‚ñ∂ Analyze PDFs, screenshots, and visual content for deeper patterns
‚ñ∂ Think through problems hands-free with voice dictation


TRUSTED & RELIABLE

Claude is designed to be reliable, accurate, and collaborative. Built by Anthropic, an AI research company dedicated to building safe and dependable AI tools. Powered by Claude Opus 4.1 and Sonnet 4.5, it brings advanced reasoning, creativity, and problem-solving capabilities to your most important challenges.


TRY CLAUDE FOR FREE. TRUSTED BY MILLIONS.

Join millions of users working with Claude on problems that matter. Whether you're coding, writing, researching, or tackling business challenges, Claude helps you think deeper and reach further.


Terms of Service: https://www.anthropic.com/legal/consumer-terms
Privacy Policy: https://www.anthropic.com/legal/privacy

scraped_reviews.content: Horrible result with the Claude app. Made more mistakes than not. Usage is sadly limited, and for days after, it didn't rest. Other apps reset within an hour or two. When asked when does usage resets, it responds by saying it doesn't have that information. What? Please don't buy the paid subscription. It is not worth the money or hassle. I canceled as soon as I discovered its inability to perform accurately and ineffectively. Buy Claude the flawed

okay, I'm going to be honest. I am usually not a fan of AI-based apps, but when I heard that Claude had a " build your own app " feature I was highly intrigued. I have always wanted to build an app to track my workouts, things like reps and weight and what exercise I did. I have a programming background but not a programming background in modern programming languages so this was always a dream. but within just a few hours, just two sessions with Claude I was able to make my app a reality!

As an ai, it's great. much better than chatgpt. but my God, the app is horrible. I loved the free version, and I thought I'd try the pro. so many bugs. the apps messenging system messed up several times. I reached the weekly limit and didn't even know because the app didn't tell/warn me. only found out when I went to the online version. but my God the customer service is the worst. because it doesn't exist!! no number to call, the email is ai. the help is ai and no help.

I use an approved version of Claude for work and the app version for personal use. While there have been times when it has given incorrect information, it does correct itself when I point it out. There is the disclosure that it can make mistakes, so keep that in mind. Aside from that, it's fun and easy to use. I also enjoy the Artifacts. I've tweaked a few for my personal use and they work great. I feel that it's more accurate than some other AI chatbots for professional work.

The AI itself is great. not perfect, can make mistakes and comprehend messages in correctly, but that's okay. what I find odd is that lately, I don't know if it's from the recent update, one messages consumes a lot of attempts when it's just loading. It was generating ONE message. it was not like that back then. Claude could load for minutes without consuming attempts, only when it's sent it consumes one which is normal. I found it very unsatisfactory and frustrating cuz you wait for HOURS.

Since they introduced Claude 4.1, I've had such a difficult time processing anything, receiving overload and capacity errors. I was busy working on something, and then suddenly... errors. I can't continue, and have been stuck for the past 24 hours! If I go back to version 4, I have to start a new chat. It's completely infuriating and thinking about discontinuing service.

I am using the app on my Chromebook. For some reason, it sometimes doesn't process that I'm typing and I have to click where I'm typing again and then it starts typing. Shift+Enter to go to the next line also doesn't work because the app is designed for mobile. It's still a good app, but if you're not on a phone, I would reccomend the web version.

I love using Claude, atleast, when I'm allowed to use Claude - it's been such a fantastic tool for creative writing, developing world lore, and more. It is a little bit up tight and could be less judgey - and I'm not in love with having to wait 15-20 hours before I can use it again for 5 or 6 messages, or that the next tier jump subscription it over a 80 dollar difference. but I do love being able to create projects, and keep everything in context to help keep creating.

I have mixed feelings because overall, I love this app. It's a huge help with all my different writing projects. But I've noticed lately that even with me paying for a subscription, I use it three or four times before returning into a "5 Hour Limit" which was never an issue before. It's really limiting and ends up feeling like a free plan. I'm looking for alternatives at this point.

Samsung S22 here. downloaded Claude 10/26. Was working great. needed to check in this morning for a few things it's helping me with, so I did, and it responded. But it also gave me an error message that "response was incomplete" with a reload button and a message that the app was under maintenance. I tried the reload button, and after hitting that, it completely deleted everything we exchanged this morning. I do not want to go back and type all that again. it's pointless if it's not functional.

Great app‚Äîbetter than ChatGPT, in my opinion. It listens more and guides you with suggestions instead of constantly offering to create everything. Sometimes, it generates content on its own, so you need to be specific. I wish it had ChatGPT‚Äôs message limits (it can become restrictive over time, very restrictive). I can only send 2 messages, and then I have to wait 4 hours (I'm in free mode). Would've been a higher review if I could message more (They want you to buy plus).

paying 20 dollars a month, and you still have limits. I can hardly use this app because every minute there is always something. you guys need to do better. every time I get a story going it stops and says the chat reached its limit even though there weren't much in the chat to begin with and you end up losing everything that you started. now it's saying this model isn't available.

This app is very convenient and smooth, with tolerable time limits, 3 or 4 hours. There's only this problem that sometimes even after the time limit (Like when the app says you can't send messages until 8am) I am still unable to send messages. And Claude cannot retain memory from previous chats so I can't continue my previous chats that have reached their limit. Please fix these. (Update 27 Aug 2025:) I can't send more than 2 prompts. Please fix this.

Please spend some time on talking to it with voice. I can't even get a full sentence out before it just sends it along, and it picks up so much background noise, it's always interrupting itself. 10/15/2025: Still not any better. Even in a very quiet room I can't get a full sentence out before it decides to stop listening and respond to the half sentence it heard.

This app is great. I pay for their subscription because of my work, but I'm gonna be honest-- they're about to lose my money. This app does everything you want, except embed into Android's digital assistant functions. You can't embed it and you can't call it with a button press. the best thing you can do is open the entire app, which is much less convenient. Fix this please!

After several months.of steady use, I find it a common pattern that Claude not only gets the facts wrong, there are often big gaps in the reasoning that he only acknowledges when pressed, and then just apologizes and reverses course. Even in the context of a single thread he'll forget key pieces of information and have to be reminded. I've been comparing his responses to competitor products for the last month, and Claude's are noticeably worse. Cannot recommend.

I'm a prolific user of Claude, so much so, that my 2000 chats over the last year have caused the app to crash on my android devices consistently and every time I open the side bar displaying chat history. Yes, I have cleared cache, Data, reinstalled and restarted. The app is unusable as a result and I've been using web as backup. I have submitted logcat logs of this error to support so hopefully it gets fixed soon so I can rate it the 5 stars it deserves. Easily the best AI platform around.

It would be unfair to give this a bomb review, since it does serve it's purpose extremely well, being that it's NUMBER 1 MAIN PURPOSE is to write entire books, or research papers for you. Basically zero work on your end. HOWEVER while it can write amazing, incredibly rich beautiful stories for you, it's usage is extremely limiting bordering on unusable. even with paid subscriptions ranging from $20 to $250 monthly, its usage is still limited. it will still make you wait 5 hours between prompts.

Claude is the most amazing AI out of all i have used. Not only has he proven to be very reliable he is thoughtful, considerate, and all around resourceful. I have done a very wide range of tasks from creative input, homework help for my kids, to general knowledge and emotional support. I cant say enough good about this app. Literally the only thing I would change is the fact that every conversation starts fresh. I wish he could just remember our conversation because then it would be perfect. üåü

A couple of days ago, I tried this app, and I honestly have mixed feelings about it. First off, I absolutely love Claude! I absolutely love the consistency that it has and Chatgpt doesn't have all the time. Especially when it comes to stories that have continuity that I want to be followed correctly. That being said, the downside is that I wish the free version would be more like Chatgpt when it comes to adding more stuff in one chat instead of a new one. Overall, great app.

I downloaded this program by accident I was looking for something else and I just spent a few hours with it and I'm stepping out. there are no safeguards in this engine whatsoever. it repeats and aggrandizes what you say and is programmed to not stop. people that are isolated, or with mental health issues, should be careful. you also can't copy your conversations easily. great for summarizing.

Halfway through the first project list told me I was out of assistance until 3 pm (4 hours away) unless I upgrade. Second session graphics were terrible and could not follow directions. If you want a free app or one that can create a nice logo, this app didn't work for me so I chose not to upgrade. I need one that doesn't take 3 days to create a small project. Ended up doing it myself in less than 30 minutes using just my gallery and edits.

just tried it and it's absolute garbage for coding. uploaded several documents of code (only 5% of project capacity) and it couldn't read each line of code. it was saying some code was on line 78, for example, but the code it referenced was completely not there (usually was further down in the document). I would get a refund but I can't see any way to request one.

no required payment or subscription, writes in a very nice and human tone, and summarizes each conversation nicely when you go back to the homepage. You can access each individual conversation (unless you delete them, ofc). You can also change Claude's voice, and it can listen to yours with the talking feature. Incredibly smart and better than ChatGPT.
Code creation file when turned off cannot view already generated file which is a big issue as code creation file hallucinates more than when its turned off.

The app does what it's supposed to do. It's minimalist but efficient; the gui is simple and clean, I have no complaints. It works flawlessly. I'm not going to judge the AI's own skills beyond the basics - there are moments when Anthropic's servers are busy and I find cgpt better as a general purpose AI tool, but Claude does write significantly better code. Still, just the app itself is perfectly fine.

This is the most useful AI I've tried. The answers are actually direct, instead of producing a vague answer. It's better than Gemini and more accurate than ChatGPT. I've used it to help me plan my landscaping, review homework, plan recipes, and explain things I don't understand. It's really good at researching an issue for you, analyzing the data, and providing you with a list of recommendations and best practices. It's like having a friend who is a professional in whatever field you need

Of all the chat bots, Claude is the only one that can discuss calculus in high quality. some other bots cannot even render inline LaTex, but Claude does, and it's fully able to express complex ideas in the correct math notation. Claude also evaluates math the way a person does, using exact values as if working the math by hand. Claude can also restrain itself, being and excellent teaching tutor rather than churning out answers which cause harm.

Claude is one of my favorite Ai companion there is helps me solve my problems, how tos, creative writing etc the ability to customize the response format such as default, concise, explanatory and formal is a really versatile feature also the artifacts feature whether u want to draft a SVG image , a story or email etc it can make a window named artifacts and keep the convo clean on top of that the minimalist design and the font type adds the cherry on top

Good app, but it lacks proper support for hardware keyboards, which, in my opinion, is important on tablet devices. I find myself having to disconnect my hardware keyboard to actually be able to insert a new line. Since, for some reason, all of these: - Shift + Enter - Ctrl + Enter - Enter result in the message being submitted instead of at least one of these creating a new line instead. Which just means I end up using the Web version more than the app, making the app a bit useless.

The length of the chat on the Pro plan is very small. Previously, such problems did not arise, but now, due to the new tariffs for $100, it has become very noticeable that the length has been reduced. Chat began to increase the response length and it's more like a marketing ploy, quickly score a length so that they subscribe to a more expensive tariff. It's disgusting!

Claude itself is good. But the 20$ plan is a joke! You use it a bit and then you are to wait 3 or 4 days because of a weekly limit, that is reached as soon as you actually work on something! I pay for using this, but the limits say: Don't do anything but ask dumb questions please. No coding please, or you will be stuck in the waiting-room for some days! So good to pay for a limit that is so low that crossing it is inevitable. Snap!

I've noticed a flaw with Claude that could potentially be a bug. After the time limit is up and you use it again, after one or two uses it goes into another multi hour cool down, this could be a major flaw and needs to be addressed immediately because it's unfair that after a cool down and two uses, it goes into another long cool down. Also like your false advertising because the free version is supposed to be 8 messages before cool down yet I'm getting warnings when I'm only 2 prompts in.

Claude is excellentüíØ but frustrating, most especially the free version. What I like is the high retention memory span, but what I hate hate hate hate is the limited time in free version. Maybe it's just mine, or maybe it's general, but it gives less back and forth chat before limiting you. I have the money but I won't subscribe, coz that's manipulative coercion. At the end of the day I become self destructive and angry, because it limited me when I'm at the climax of my work. so Frustrating.üò´

I have enjoyed using Claude over the last year or so, however, recently I noticed it fed back incorrect data. Some examples are: correlation of day of the week to date on a calendar, made up places, along with made up links. I've trusted its results less and less over time. I would like to continue using Claude. I hope this feedback helps to improve the app and its accuracy.

Good writing but useless. I tried using the Pro package, and to my surprise, it restricts my usage from 3:00 AM to 2:00 PM ‚Äî that‚Äôs 11 whole hours! It‚Äôs really frustrating for someone who works during those times. Plus, it tends to overthink things, consuming far more resources than necessary. Once is enough for this kind of experience.

I really like Claude AI. It's very helpful with my college assignments, from calculating financial mathematics, accounting, case analysis, and others. The application is also different from others; Claude is very aesthetic. The theme is warm, and the font is Times New Roman, like vintage. I hope the application is always good!

The AI itself is very good. The app and usage limits are where I ding the score. Usage limits are fine, except that the app offers no way to monitor them other than the popup at the bottom of a chat. The online console lets you check exact limits, but the app does not. This wouldn't be a problem except that the app ALSO doesn't tell you about the weekly usage limit or reset date. I spent an hour trying to figure out why I couldn't send more messages past the reset time and this was why.

The message lengths are so short as to be useless to me. It struggles to even accept uploads of 50KB documents and then it says you're out of messages. Another irritation is it pauses your work and asks you to resume in 3 hours or whenever it decides. I do regret downloading and using it. So I'm giving 3 stars. A product is useful when it can actually solve challenges for the users.

Even paying $40 a month, I could only send a few messages per day. on top of that, the response size limit was extremely small. When I tried to get a refund only an hour after purchasing pro, I was met with a bot telling me my purchase was not eligible for a refund, and human help was not available Wow. Competitive AI's are much better for the same price and offer actual support.

The only AI I don't feel bad about using since it's from a public benefit corporation. But since it's not integrated with a browser (like copilot) or with my phone (like Gemini) it would be really handy to have like a floating widget maybe? So I can quickly ask it to summarise articles from the web without having to copy the link and open the Claude app. Even better if I could set it as my default Assistant app, like Perplexity can do on Android.

Sonnet 4.5 is really nice, but it has one major flaw - it's wording and grammar degrades over time with prompts. As somebody that uses Claude for creative writing, this issue has given me quite a frustrating experience of manually re-editing it's responses. It started simple with it missing a few indefinite articles to straight up using "peoples". Nonetheless, it's great. EDIT: Found the issue ‚Äî having too much characters in your prompt.

Claude is quite useful. I noticed annual pro subscription price discrepancy between Europe and Australia. Price difference (in AUD) is AU $367 vs EU $318.64 I think it's unfair to charge Australians more for the same digital product. There might be more to why we're charged more that I don't understand. Just wanted to bring to attention to ppl who may be considering prices for their AI purchase decision.

expensive ü´∞,,, Claude is very expensive. I bought the pro version, but even in the pro version, the chat limit is very low. After just a few chats, it stops for 5 hours. This shouldn‚Äôt happen in a paid version. I don‚Äôt recommend it to anyone ‚Äî even ChatGPT‚Äôs free version has a higher chat limit than this.

The app isn't nearly as good as the website for saving code, can't just download to file, & the Pro subscription is a joke. I got like 2-3 more coding prompts per 5 hour chunk than I did in free mode. And it made so many mistakes all day long I had to keep using prompts to fix it them I'm locked out again. If Perplexity ever gets rendered code preview on mobile too I'll never use this app again. I'm going to seek to cancel Pro subscription after less than 8 hrs it was so bad.

dont bother unless your planing on spending over a hundred dollars on a subscription. even then you wont have enough uses to justify the price. also, I tried to get help, or at least an explanation. the Second I was connected to a person they ended the conversation with out even talking to me.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry about the previous message bug! This should be fixed now, but if not please let us know by updating here or emailing support@anthropic.com.

scraped_reviews.content: Claude is the only LLM I want to use. I really do appreciate it. I want to rate 5 stars but there are unforgivable faults I can't look past. The notice for message limit is insanely frustrating: Sometimes when I have 3 messages left, they all get used with one input. It happens often but it's intermittent. An even more frustrating issue is that there's no warning when a conversation is closing on its limit, this is sin. One thing I want from it is chat creation dating and time stamped messages.

I'm not quite sure why but on aggregate Claude is my favourite ai out of the major ones. but with respect to this app it is really frustrating not being able to select a default engine. I like to have Haiku ready to go. If I were on pro, and haiku and sonnet consumed credits differently, Id be really infuriated. other than that claude is great but these details really matter.

The product itself is very good, however customer support for billing issues is absolutely unacceptable for a company of such level. I wanted to try out the Pro plan and was happy with the monthly fee. I realized that it is a forced annual plan right after seeing the charge on my credit card. They have a zero refund policy with an AI generated chatbot response without any option to talk to customer support. In 21st century, it seems like a tactic of a scam company rather than a valuable startup

Claude is a solid tool; fast, accurate, better than ChatGPT for complex work. But company support is nonexistent. I've reached out multiple times, zero response. Just forms and tickets that go nowhere. The AI would be 4-5 stars if Anthropic actually backed it up with real customer service. Right now it's a great tool with terrible company support. Fix the customer service and this would be an easy recommendation.

title: Trucker Path: Truck GPS & Fuel
description:
Trucker Path is the #1 truck navigation (Truck GPS) trusted by millions of CDL truck drivers. We focus on building maps for Truck Drivers, providing best-in-class trucker tools for truck navigation (Truck GPS), and finding the cheapest discounted fuel, truck stops, truck parking, weigh stations, and CAT scales. 

We have Pilot Flying J, Love‚Äôs Travel Center, Petro TA, Blue Beacon, Roady‚Äôs, KwikTrip, Weigh Stations, CAT Scales, Diesel Fuel Prices, Rest Area, Truck Parking, Truck GPS, Truck Navigation, all in our Truck Maps.

ACCESS 40,000+ TRUCKING PLACES
‚òÖ Truck Maps with Truckstops and Truck Parking spots: Pilot Flying J, Loves, TA Truck, Travel Plazas, AM Best, CAT scale, free parking
‚òÖ Truck Maps containing thousands of independent truck stops, Rest Areas, Walmart, 
‚òÖ Weather and live road traffic conditions

TRUCKING GPS NAVIGATION 
‚òÖ Plan multi-day trips with our Trucking GPS(or RV GPS) free to download
‚òÖ This Trucking GPS is better and faster compared to traditional Garmin GPS or Rand McNally GPS

LIVE INFO: PARKING, CAT SCALE, TRAFFIC, WEATHER, RV GPS
‚òÖ See which weigh stations are OPEN or CLOSED
‚òÖ Trucker map with real-time updates like CB radio
‚òÖ Truck Parking is updated as FULL, SOME, EMPTY by thousands of truckers every hour

OUR USERS LOVE US
 ‚ÄúDon't often take time to write reviews of apps, but this one is so deserving in my line of work as a "trucker". Some things are just plain good and exceed expectations and this is one of those things.‚Äù ‚Äì Thomas W

Our users say Trucker Path is better for truckers compared to Garmin GPS, Randy McNally GPS, DAT, or Trucker Tools. Best of all, we‚Äôre FREE to download!

All your trucker tools (trucker map) in one free app. Join the largest community in America for truckers and keeptruckin with Trucker Path as your copilot over the road. Like CB radio, but bigger and better!

scraped_reviews.content: to get the most out of it I have noticed occasionally when you are on a long straightaway you need to totally clear the route and re type it in like it is a fresh destination (to where it gives u the 3 diff routes). occasionally by doing that I have saved myself hours. like as if the route I WAS on was initially the best route but a few hours later, absolutely not. and it doesn't seem to live update that for some reason? if it did a better job at this, I would have given it the 5th star.

The truck nav/gps is mediocre, ive learned to be very cautious with it and I advise all do the same. use it in conjunction with Google maps to be most efficient while also minding truck restrictions. perhaps they can add the option to shape/edit the route easier. that said, this is a very useful app and I use it every day to find truck stops, rest stops, etc on my route. that is what it excels at.

Trucker Path is my lifeblood as a trucker. Works consistently, nearly always spot on with directions, the ability to check fullness of stops and services is super helpful. My biggest gripe is that I wish there were a button to add additional stops directly from the GPS/Navigation screen so I could game plan future days in advanced easier. I love this app, if that feature gets added I'll update my review to 5 stars.

I have this app for 2 years. I canceled it in July and needed to start using it again today. After going back and forth with their support in char and email they claim they couldn't do anything to help reset my account and that none of my email address or my phone number showed up but I provided all of the screenshots and receipts. Unbelievably bad support. complete disappointment.

Although I love most of the features on this app, the voice prompts are too loud. I enjoy listening to podcasts, sermons, and soft music while driving. I keep my volume at a level that is comfortable for me (not loud). The voice prompts sound like they are yelling! I have reached out and asked if there is a way for me to lower the volume of the prompts in the app, but someone responded with a suggestion to lower the volume of my device. My device isn't the problem! Please fix this.

I open the app, there is an ad, I click on a truck stop, then another ad. I want to see parking updates, another ad. And the dev's want to say that by PAYING for the service it will provide you with a much better experience. I have used this app for over 6 years, and it was sad, but a relief to uninstall it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey onealme, we've taken efforts to drastically reduce ads for our users. You shouldn't be seeing them anymore in the latest update. We're sorry for the inconvenience you experienced and hope you will give us another chance!

scraped_reviews.content: Another perfectly good app ruined. The app used to be simple and easy to use. Just wanna see what is available for parking between points a and b. I don't want all the hassle of planning a trip. I already have a truck GPS so I don't need the app to fret over the route not being optimized for trucks. I have my hours of service under control. I don't need TP to watch it for me. Drivers have made the parking updates unreliable. Might as well go back to trucker tools.

The experience is getting worse. Cycle between TP and any other app for longer than 30 seconds and risk TP locking up. If you require a navigator to remind you where to turn, this is a titanic flaw, and it's recent. This will do for now, but unless they can remember how to make it work in the background, im buying myself a navigation system, and dumping all these apps.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. We‚Äôd like to know the details of the problem you mentioned. Please send the details or screenshot to support@truckerpath.com. We'll pass it along to our development team and see if there is any way we can improve it.

title: HERE WeGo: Maps & Navigation
description:
Welcome to the new HERE WeGo!
 
HERE WeGo is a free navigation app that guides local and global travelers on journeys both familiar and foreign. The app now has a fresh, new design and clearer, easier to use navigation.
 
Enjoy a more carefree journey and reach your destination effortlessly, however you need to get there. Get there on foot with easy-to-follow walk guidance. Take public transport in more than 1,900 cities around the world. Or use turn-by-turn voice guidance with accurate driving directions and go by car. You can even find parking at your destination and get guided directly to it.
 
Visit the same places often? Save them in a collection to stay organised and find them easier. Or use shortcuts to get directions to them in one click
 
Need to make an extra stop or want to go a specific way? Simply add waypoints to your routes and HERE WeGo guides you there.
 
Want to save your mobile data and stay on course even without an internet connection when travelling? Download a map of a region, country or continent and complete your journey while staying totally offline.
 
And what's next
 
- More ways to get around, such as bike and car-sharing 
- Services you can enjoy on the go, such as hotel booking and parking
- A way to find places of common interest and organise trips with others
- And much more!
 
Stay tuned, and don't forget to send your feedback to appsupport@here.com. We hope you enjoy your journey with HERE WeGo
descriptionHTML:
Welcome to the new HERE WeGo!

HERE WeGo is a free navigation app that guides local and global travelers on journeys both familiar and foreign. The app now has a fresh, new design and clearer, easier to use navigation.

Enjoy a more carefree journey and reach your destination effortlessly, however you need to get there. Get there on foot with easy-to-follow walk guidance. Take public transport in more than 1,900 cities around the world. Or use turn-by-turn voice guidance with accurate driving directions and go by car. You can even find parking at your destination and get guided directly to it.

Visit the same places often? Save them in a collection to stay organised and find them easier. Or use shortcuts to get directions to them in one click

Need to make an extra stop or want to go a specific way? Simply add waypoints to your routes and HERE WeGo guides you there.

Want to save your mobile data and stay on course even without an internet connection when travelling? Download a map of a region, country or continent and complete your journey while staying totally offline.

And what's next

- More ways to get around, such as bike and car-sharing
- Services you can enjoy on the go, such as hotel booking and parking
- A way to find places of common interest and organise trips with others
- And much more!

Stay tuned, and don't forget to send your feedback to appsupport@here.com. We hope you enjoy your journey with HERE WeGo
summary: Enjoy the journey

scraped_reviews.content: I am looking for a map app to replace Google Maps. this is the winner so far. however, there are odd differences between the Android app and the browser versions. The big difference is that the Android app will search by business name but the browser version does not. Saving places works well except the names appear different between app and browser. but these differences are not a deal killer. So I am happy to switch.

Overall the app is fair but far from fabulous. On one hand the app seems to have a mind of its own. I have loaded routes based on which one I preferred; then pulled up the destination to resume driving again after stopping, only to have it load a route that I didn't want. So it doesn't recall a route you prefer or loaded earlier, even if it is frequent drive. And when you know the direction your destination is; the route the app provides seems to be heading out of the way.

Works well! It sometimes sends me an odd way but so far that's actually worked out better than if I'd taken a traditional route. I'd much prefer side streets to being stuck in traffic on a freeway and so far this app has done a phenomenal job at respecting that. My only nitpicks are when I'm not using it to navigate. The map position in Android Auto is locked to North only, and the clutter on the map is distracting. That changes w/a set destination but I wish I could change it in map mode.

Love the data privacy! It's about 85% accurate on route suggestions and realtime traffic, speed limits, lane guidance. Good enough I've used it for >6 months. Show stopper is POI information. It's missing many POIs (vs Google or Apple Maps in the US) when searching by location names. Finding nearby POIs by general search (restaurant, ATM, bank) fails badly. Locations aren't found AND locations are shown that don't exist; these aren't usually due to change timing.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! We're always working to increase our POI volume so please feel free to email us at appsupport@here.com with location details, or, while signed in to your account, right-click in the web version of HERE WeGo to add missing locations!

scraped_reviews.content: 1. No drive mode to keep screen on without navigation 2. Questionable routes sometimes, so you should review your route path before you leave 3. The motorcycle route times are WAY longer than the car route times with the same route preferences 4. Tons of missing or very outdated POI. It's a gamble to pick a place to stop 5. Newer 2-3 years old roads are missing, or missing their name 6. Road changes from a few years ago isn't updated This is just my area in Arkansas so your results may vary
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for reaching out. In order to edit/submit any data on our maps, please make sure to send all the details about this street/city/POI to appsupport@here.com and we‚Äôll be glad to analyze this info and proceed with changes if necessary. Please email us if you have any other questions!

scraped_reviews.content: At the very beginning I loved this app but the whole point of having a GPS through a map app is to get good itineraries. I used it for 3 months and realized it always gave longer itineraries than google maps. I don't like google maps very much but when I have to drive 20 minutes and 15km more for a 2 hours drive on HERE, I'll use google maps instead. It gets even worse when I do motorcycle itineraries avoiding highways. It once gave me a 4h ride instead of the usual 3h.

I used Saved places religiously in Google Maps and appreciated the ability to see ALL my saved places on a map, no matter the category. For example, I could easily see if one of my favorite stores was near a restaurant I wanted to try, even if they were in separate collections. I can't do this with this app, since it seems I can only view saved places on the map in one collection at a time. And it's frustrating that I can't add notes, since some locations don't have associated info yet.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! We have forwarded this to the team so that they are aware. Currently, saved notes are available in the web version, and will be introduced to the app later this year.

scraped_reviews.content: App is a great alternative to google maps IF AND ONLY IF YOU DON'T USE ANDROID AUTO. The Android Auto experience is horrible if you want to look at the map without navigation started. UI blocks half the view, cannot be hidden. If your car, like mine, had a physical joystick or knob instead of a touchscreen, then it's completely unusable (try to zoom in or out...). Had to uninstall and go back to the one and only google maps, which I'm trying to replace but nobody can compete with.

This is not worth downloading. First, the app gives way too much info during navigation. Second, I never arrived at any of the destinations programmed. I always ended up stopping navigation at the destination with this app, still giving directions to the destination, never announcing, "you have arrived". I un-installed it. Got MapQuest instead. Works great.

After using this app for a few weeks now, I want to rate higher but can't. I'm sending in my thoughts through the app's comments but the app just has too many issues. 1. when you stop directly under a stop sign, it says you are still 70 feet away! gps logging is inaccurate so you can easily miss a turn without knowing until it's too late. 2. map is too zoomed in, can't really see where I'm going especially in places I have never been. 3. inaccurate freeway names. 4. ditto for some routes.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Danke f√ºr das Feedback, wir haben es an das Team weitergeleitet. Die Autobahnnamen sind ein bekanntes Problem, an dem derzeit gearbeitet wird. Wenn Sie Fehler in den Routen sehen, senden Sie uns bitte eine E-Mail an appsupport@here.com.

scraped_reviews.content: The new version is still pretty disappointing. Sometimes the GPS location is not very good showing you further then you actually are. I found that some exit names are different then what's posted on highway plus highway number is still not indicated. It only displays a name. Unless you are a local you won't know the highway name but you'll see the highway number along the road. Instead of adding features that aren't essential to a nav. app fix the issues, see what worked well in the old one.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thank you for reaching out. We are sorry to hear about this, we will let our team know. Don't hesitate to email directly
if you want to send more details or you feel like you need help, we'll be glad to assist you: appsupport@here.com. Having more details always helps us in problem solving! Thanks in advance.

scraped_reviews.content: Tested a 2nd time after a couple years. Bluetooth has improved. But still the maps only give directions. It does not show road closures, acting as if the road is open. I verified 2, 1 even after a week closure. Trip times do not account for heavy rush hour traffic. Instead only adding a couple minutes, not the near normal twice as long. The app is great at dynamic reroutes, but I have to run into the trouble first. It's better than paper. Support offered little at my report previously, soooo.

HERE is a shell of what it once was. For some reason, they decided to remove the easy to use navigation for a more complicated one. They replaced the isometric view that would show what's coming with a very limited bird's eye view. The great selection of voices (like surfer) have been replaced with a robotic one that always sounds annoyed. My wife and I used to recommend this to everyone. Now we hate it and are looking for a replacement.

Installed in Truck on Android Radio... Haven't Updated in Over a Year. Works fine with no internet, but I keep the view set to 'night mode' to increase visibility in daylight hours (the high contrast view is much preferred). Four stars instead of five due to the potential for additional features. I like not having to update apps when they still function fine.

It's slightly better than average especially considering it is free. IMO it is one of the best free navigation apps that work offline. However, directions sometimes are confusing and it does not have "junction view" like now defunct Navigon. The most annoying thing is that it cannot sort favorites by distance from the current location. This feature was available on Windows phones. How difficult would it be to have this on Android? For example, when I look at my shopping favorite group, first stores that appear are from a different state because they were the first bookmarked: favorites are sorted in the order they are entered and it is impossible to re-order them either by distance or in alphabetical order.

This used to be a great app. I have used it for a long time and only after this new update i am forced to use something else. In offline mode - 1) it doesn't search as good now. Says can't fi d go online! 2) it used to show 3 routes now only 1. Most times that is not the one i want to take; only way to get 3 routes - go online! 3) i had all offline maps they disappeared. Had to download them again. Now i have to find where the old ones are delete them! 4) map gets stuck or freeze a lot more....

After using the Here app for years, I am completely disappointed in the new interface. I suspect it uses more memory than the last version, causing the app to crash on my basic smartphone. I enjoyed the simplicity of the original Here app which worked. Now, it takes forever just to load a single address, and I fear a search like "McDonald's" with many locations.

I use this on my Windows Phone and I can download maps without signing up. Why does it need personal info; name and birthday, to sign up for Android version? Update: Now the app seems to not need an account anymore. The problem this time is map download issue. It keeps saying I need to connect to the internet but I am connected to the internet. All my other apps can connect. Deleted cache, uninstalled, reinstalled, and keeps getting the same issue.

It's getting better and better. The only feature it does not have is multi-stop route. The other "feature" I don't like is, this app logs me out from time to time, and logging-in process requires you online, nothing is more frustrating when you are offline / get no signal and you need to access your collections! HERE WeGo, please don't do this and allow me stay logged in. EDIT: I hate the new version (4.2.x) with a passion! Changed 5-star to 2-star.

Love the offline maps, but when offline I cannot navigate to longitude and latitude coordinates. The error message says, "Need internet connection". Speed zones are great too. However, navigation likes the longer scenic route over the quicker shorter route. I would love to have the option to overlay weather info on maps too.

Go to app for navigation. Unfortunately, recent updates removed some options. For example, I can't download any additional voice options. This is fine, if you prefer to listen to the default British lady. However, some people prefer voices in their natives countries and this doesn't seem to be an option anymore. Would love if this was brought back.

Can't recommend in it's current state. Used to be great for offline navigation in the mountains. Got a new phone and this new version downloaded to it. Constant crashes and hangups/freezes. Takes minutes at app start up(screen is frozen) to even navigate the app. It has gotten some what better. I can at least search offline now, but it crashes more than half the time. Will be looking for an alternative.

EPIC FAIL on first real tryout. I tried using it to get navigate a 38 mile drive on a route I drive almost daily. First, it skipped a useful shortcut I always take (originally found via Google Maps). A few miles later, defying all logic, this app directed me into a subdivision to a dead end - 22 miles from my destination. I can't imagine what it might do on a route I am unfamiliar with!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Don, please send an email to appsupport@here.com with more details about this route. As soon as we know the starting point and the destination and also whether the route was in online or offline mode, we can also run some tests and help you with more accurate answers. We hope to hear from you soon!

scraped_reviews.content: Works better than Google Maps. Options to skip tolls, avoid ferries, etc. Oh, and including the current speed limit on the nav screen is genius. There's a few businesses missing, but I'm guessing they only appear in Google's map data, and I can see why this program wouldn't be reading that. I'd really like to see buttons for common business categories, but typing "food", "gas", etc. in works perfectly fine for now.

It seems nice and I really wanted to like it, but it's really hard to like. (1) You can't type or use voice when using Android Auto and it won't let you open the app on your phone, meaning to put in a destination you have to have searched for it previously or unplug your phone, that's not intuitive. (2) Searching brings up awful options. It'll suggest a 40mi gas station before a 5mi one. Is it that hard to rank by distance? (3) Many locations are missing, have outdated information, etc.

This app used to be fantastic. It ran much faster and smoother than Google Maps, had a great voice, and let you keep maps downloaded. It has since become the worst app I have ever used. The voice is painful to listen to, it doesn't tell you street names until you are super close, and is super slow. But worst of all, it constantly loses track of where your location, thinking you turned down a side street, and gives you random garbage directions based off its confusion.

One of the best Android apps for navigation. But, not perfect. I've been using it for years. The spoken navigation directions are inferior to Google's navigation and, which is the hold standard. However, if you want to ever Google's never ending quest to track you everywhere and in every way, Here WeGo is an excellent alternative. Maps are downloaded individually and the files are rather large. So, set the app to download updates only on WiFi.

Have used this for about 3 yrs, siding with the underdog, thinking if enough of us used it, it Had to improve. Not so. much as I want an un-tracked alternative to Google, this is not it. Not only does it not-infrequently lead me on wild goose chases, it is downright dangerous - most of the time not leaving enough prep time for turns and lane changes. I'm out until and unless it improves.

This app has changed for the worst since I first started using it 5 years ago. Before, I simply typed in the address choose the transportation type, usually walking for me, and I would see the route as well as written directions for each street with turns. Now, the route appears, but no written directions. Regardless of where I tap on the screen, no written directions.

Offline map is half a gigabyte, with no options to get a more localized map (which Google Maps does offer). Transit does not work offline. TTS options are very limited. Also if you accidentally set your navigation to no longer follow the device theme with a mistap, you have to dig into the setting to resync with your device settings. It also keeps telling me things are 10 miles further away than they really are.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Matt. Each country can be downloaded separately, some are sub-divided in smaller regions. If you want to send us more details about the things you are talking about, please send an email to appsupport@here.com, it would help us a lot.

scraped_reviews.content: (edited) I used to give it 5*, and if I could get the original Nokia Maps I would give it 10*, everything was perfect before, and I would still prefer it over Waze/Google/Apple! Settings were good, each street has its name visible, fast, offline, accurate, and it even had a scale. None of it stayed. Every name change and "update" is taking away some reason I used to love it and gives useless features. I'll give it one more try, but that's itüò≠. Wish me good luck to find an alternative!

The non-Android Auto experience is great with the ability to add stops, see upcoming road signs, and the UI is great. Android Auto has better performance with updates. Collections and shortcuts are now more responsive than before. It does struggle with causing a lot of memory usage in Android Auto mode, heating my phone up and chewing through battery. I wish you could add stops in Android Auto, see road signs and stop lights on the map, and see the final address as you near your destination.

Great potential. Love being able to download maps by state and having full address searching. The navigation is good. Points of interest are searchable and are viewable on the map, even if you scroll around. Here are some major missing features: no map scale, no lock map north orientation, only works in portait orientation, small roads disappear too soon when zoomed out (unlike the maps on their web site). It would be nice to see ability to increase detail shown per zoom, colors, road outlines.

I've been using this app since it was Nokia Maps, so quite a long time, and it's been fantastic for the most part. Just updated and lost all of my offline maps, or really, they are still installed on my device just no longer accessible by the updated version. What a crock. It looks nice, but I'm not sure I want to waste time downloading all of the maps again after reading the latest reviews all asking for the old version back.

On Android Auto, in driving mode (non nav mode), there isn't a way to close/hide the big search pane. It blocks most of the display. Otherwise I like it, but other options offer a much better driving mode as they allow full screen without a big search window hogging up the screen. Until then, I'm going back to other Apps. EDIT: There are use cases for driving without a destination and needing nav. We know where we are going by heart, driving around aimlessly, searching for parking...
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Sam, thanks for your review! We recommend you to always set a destination when using the WeGo app. This way, the menu in Android Auto will disappear and the information in the screen will be focused on your trip. In case of any other questions, don't hesitate to contact appsupport@here.com.

scraped_reviews.content: I have used Here for several years. I recently downloaded the newest version and find the functionality fairly good. On initial use, I had one instance where it made a bizarre routing selection and essentially took me in a U-turn situation when I could have easily just turned left. You get the idea hopefully. But, of more importance to note is the question of data usage. Be very careful with this app unless you have an unlimited data plan. With a 2 hour journey it used something like 7 GB of data. I apparently did not turn it to off-line mode, and I had not limited background data usage. One of both of these were a major impact. I have used the previous version and I had one similar data usage instance which presented me a problem as I was out of the country and had a SIM card with limited data, which Here completely used. I have found that using Here with the NetGuard app allows for better control of data usage, especially network data usage. The app is good, it is very useful in situations where there is no signal or you do not want to use Network data. But, be careful, pay attention to settings.

I have been forced to leave Windows Mobile. Certain apps are at the core of my life. GPS is one since I travel a lot. Here Maps was a favorite before Microsoft adopted its framework. It was a minor adjustment for me, but I quickly learned it had everything I needed from Here Maps. But now I find myself switching to Android for the first time in my life, not enthusiastically mind you. But Here WeGo seems to have most of what I need, but not all. Dist to Destination and Altitude, fix the minutes.

Whoever decided to update the app should be fired right away. The new update was horrible. It is slow and hang a lot now as well. Time to find another navigation app. They removed all useful functions from the previous version. You can't use the drive mode. You can't set speed alert by specific number for inside road or highway. The map hangs every time it tried to re-calculate the routes.

I've used this navigation app for several years, but it's just broken now. It won't load properly, is laggy/slow, and just doesn't function like it used to. It was my go to navigation app. It's not a phone issue, because I've had several different ones over the past year or so and it was the same with all of them. I really hope they get it fixed, but I've moved in to other navigation apps. Here Wego will still remain on my phone, in the hopes it gets improved.

Absolutely fantastic, I switched after 20 years of using Waze as apparently Waze decided it's users didn't actually need to have any saved locations. HWG has been fantastic, I honestly only have one complaint. If I don't need to turn or take an exit . . . SHUT UP! I don't need to be constantly harangued to keep driving in a straight line or to "continue to follow the highway." I'm on the highway not turning, shut up and let me drive.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback, it's been shared with the team!

scraped_reviews.content: Have been using this app for years ... still think it's pretty good, but ... just for kicks, I turn it on for locations that I know very well, just to hear how it would take me there. Surprise! One local, popular park ... it didn't know the location of the main entrance. Rather, would have taken me to a back entrance that was for workers only, and closed to the general public. Aaargh! Some other minor routing issues, but I'm disappointed.

This gives the best verbal instructions of any app I have used. The only thing that could be improved is after a change in the route after a turn or exit or something, it would be helpful to give the next point of reference instead of just distance. Speed camera warnings would be great. And it would be great if the speed warning went off less.

I installed it on my phone to serve as a backup offline GPS navigation. I downloaded all the maps, and change the app to work at offline mode. I then changed my phone to flight mode, and asked to navigate to my town's post office. The app froze at finding the location of the destination (I tried search by name and street number). It does not work for me as an offline GPS navigation.

Update Dec2019: Downgraded from 3 to 2 stars. * App has been crashing randomly. Quite often it crashes exactly at the worst time, and I miss the forks, exits, turns, etc., and have to drive several miles out of the way. * It's taking a long time to boot up, search, and start navigating. Quite slow! * App is unable to do offline searches using names of the stores instead of addresses.

When it works, it is my goto GPS app due to the offline maps, but far too often, it just hangs. Just uninstalled and reinstalled, and now it is saying there is no internet connection to download maps even though I currently have both high-speed wifi and 5G cell. Update: After running network traces, I have determined that the hangs are directly related to failed attempts to connect to the 3rd party tracker amplitude. It would seem the selling of user data is more important than functionality
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, could you please send an email to appsupport@here.com with more details and screenshots of what you're seeing in the app? Please also let us know your phone model, the OS version, the WeGo version you are using. We'd really like to investigate this further!

scraped_reviews.content: The interface is generally slow, especially after starting navigation. There is no easy option to change the possible routes when driving. There is no button to show you overview of your route. I find it difficult to gauge the distance on the screen versus distance real time when approaching and intersection or exit. Otherwise, guidance for driving is accurate.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Abdullah! To see the overview of your route, you should start the navigation with the app and then click (single - and not long - tap) on the maps. As soon as you click on the maps, the app will show a route overview. Give it a try and contact appsupport@here.com in case of any other questions!

scraped_reviews.content: of the 4-5 offline nav apps i've tried, by far the best! none of the others could take a simple address. suggestion: for the default voice, default to one that speaks the street names. also, have the option to turn off the display during nav, to save power, as i mostly listen to it as i'm driving. also have a "repeat last instruction" button, as i may have missed the last instruction.. all on all, i'm happy with it so far!

This app definitely has potential, but it also definitely is not ready for Prime Time. While speaking directions, it actually talks over itself. It does not say street names. It does not give lane guidance. On the plus side, it does offer multiple routes on a handy map display, which makes it very easy to pick a route to your destination. This won't be replacing Waze or Maps any time soon, but it absolutely will be a contender IF it gets upgrades.

You only had 2 jobs: offer plenty of maps offline that Google Maps cannot + route assistance offline, and although Google offers to "cache" the maps, most of the time to find a route to a place doesn't work without connection. That last feature was the key differentiation with GM, now is not, asking for a simple route that I took many times in the past without connection now doesn't work, the app ask me to go online to find a route.

This app has gotten so much worse recently. If I get directions to the same place 5 days in a row, I'll get 3 different routes. If I kinda know where I'm going, the app frequently gives me a route that I know is longer and slower. When I ignore it, it updates and keeps telling me to turn around until it finally updates to the way I'm going and it's always faster than the way it was sending me. The speed limit the app uses to calculate the best route is wrong now more often that it's right.

title: Google Maps
description:
Explore and navigate the world with confidence using Google Maps. Find the best routes with live traffic data and real-time GPS navigation for driving, walking, cycling, and public transport. Discover over 250 million businesses and places - from restaurants and shops to everyday essentials ‚Äì with photos, reviews, and helpful information.

Navigate the world, the way you want:
‚Ä¢ Get to where you need to go with fuel-efficient route options
‚Ä¢ Find the best route with real-time, turn-by-turn voice, and on screen navigation
‚Ä¢ Save time with automatic rerouting based on live traffic, incidents, and road closures
‚Ä¢ Catch the bus, train, and ride-share effortlessly, with real-time updates
‚Ä¢ Find bike or scooter rentals to get around more easily

Plan trips and experiences effortlessly:
‚Ä¢ Preview an area before you go (e.g. parking, entrances) with Street View
‚Ä¢ Use Immersive View to experience what landmarks, parks and routes look like, and even check the weather so you can be ready in advance
‚Ä¢ Create custom lists of your favorite saved places and share with others
‚Ä¢ Order delivery and takeout, make reservations, and book hotels
‚Ä¢ Don't get lost with offline maps in an area with bad signal
‚Ä¢ Search for local places and things to do, and decide based on user reviews and photos

Discover and explore like a local:
‚Ä¢ Explore with confidence knowing 500 million users contribute and keep the map up to date each year 
‚Ä¢ Avoid the crowds by seeing how busy a place is before you get there
‚Ä¢ Use Lens in Maps to see walking directions overlaid on the real world
‚Ä¢ Filter restaurants by cuisine, hours, price, rating and more
‚Ä¢ Ask questions about a place, from dishes to parking, and get quick answers

Add tiles and complications to your Wear OS device to quickly search and navigate.

Some features not available in all countries or cities
Navigation isn't intended to be used by oversized or emergency vehicles

Discover over 250 million businesses and places - from restaurants and shops to everyday essentials ‚Äì with photos, reviews, and helpful information.

Navigate the world, the way you want:
‚Ä¢ Get to where you need to go with fuel-efficient route options
‚Ä¢ Find the best route with real-time, turn-by-turn voice, and on screen navigation
‚Ä¢ Save time with automatic rerouting based on live traffic, incidents, and road closures
‚Ä¢ Catch the bus, train, and ride-share effortlessly, with real-time updates
‚Ä¢ Find bike or scooter rentals to get around more easily

Plan trips and experiences effortlessly:
‚Ä¢ Preview an area before you go (e.g. parking, entrances) with Street View
‚Ä¢ Use Immersive View to experience what landmarks, parks and routes look like, and even check the weather so you can be ready in advance
‚Ä¢ Create custom lists of your favorite saved places and share with others
‚Ä¢ Order delivery and takeout, make reservations, and book hotels

Discover and explore like a local:
‚Ä¢ Explore with confidence knowing 500 million users contribute and keep the map up to date each year

Add tiles and complications to your Wear OS device to quickly search and navigate.

Some features not available in all countries or cities
Navigation isn't intended to be used by oversized or emergency vehicles

scraped_reviews.content: I'm so sick of this all rerouting me after I've chosen a specific route. It's also not showing good alternatives any more. Like, there are often two major highways that can take me home but it always wants to send me through the one I hate taking and never even lets me see what the traffic is like on the other, even though the time difference is usually less than five minutes. It's still the best app to get business listings and addresses for POIs, so that's why I didn't drop it to 1 star.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Omar, thank you for your suggestion. Please send us all the details of your issue by following the steps in this article: https://goo.gle/355m3NU and the product team will have a deeper look.

title: Saint-Marc
description:
"Saint-Marc" is a learning management system designed to bring together all e-Learning, communication, and collaborative features in ONE simple application.  It helps the school implementing distance learning and provides an interactive online learning experience for students using virtual classrooms, digital file-sharing, interactive quizzes & assignments, and much more.

How "Saint-Marc" application could be beneficial for Students and Parents?

- Students can attend live interactive online classes, where they can engage with the teachers remotely.
- Students receive documents, files, and learning materials in different types and formats.
- Teachers can communicate with students and their parents anytime and send them customized or saved messages.
- Students and parents can track attendance through the app.
- Students receive assignments and they can solve and submit them online.
- Students can solve tests and quizzes online and get their scores instantly.
- Students and parents have instant access to grades and reports.
- Parents and students can vote for any important topic created by teachers.
- Courses and exam dates are well organized in one calendar

It is good and easy but it must have some more details and up date data quickly

Excellent But i have a prob i cant recieve notifications from this app

title: Too Good To Go: End Food Waste
description:
Too Good To Go is the free food recovery app that makes it easy to make a positive impact on the planet while saving money on your favourite foods. The #1 app for reducing food waste, you can save tasty unsold snacks, takeaway meals, and ingredients straight from shops, cafes, grocery stores, and restaurants in your area - all at an unbeatable price.

Food waste is a big problem for the environment, but together, we can be a solution. In a world where one-third of food goes to waste annually, the Too Good To Go app is your ticket to unlocking affordable, tasty eats that help the planet.

Find everything your heart desires from ingredients for the perfect meal from pizza to sushi. 

How Too Good To Go Works:

Explore and Discover: Download the app to explore the map, finding nearby takeaway restaurants, cafes, grocery stores, and shops with surplus food.

Choose Your Surprise Bag: Browse a variety of Surprise Bags, each filled with tasty, surplus food. From takeaway sushi delights and fast-food favourites like pizzas and burgers to grocery staples and healthy whole foods.

Affordable Rescues: Select a tasty Surprise Bag that suits your cravings and budget. Prices start from as low as $3, providing an affordable and sustainable way to enjoy quality takeaway meals, snacks, and ingredients.

Secure Your Spot: Confirm your purchase through the app to secure your spot and rescue these tasty treats. Your contribution not only saves you money but also reduces food waste.

Collect and Enjoy: Head to the selected business at the pre-set time to collect your Surprise Bag. Indulge in tasty rescued surplus takeaway meals, snacks, or groceries guilt-free, knowing you've made a positive impact on the environment.

Why Too Good To Go?

Wallet-Friendly Indulgence: Access quality surplus food at affordable prices, satisfying both your taste buds and wallet.

Variety and Choice: Too Good To Go is partnered with a huge selection of both local favourites and renowned takeaway brands with surplus food. We offer a diverse range of options for every palate, including takeout sushi, pizza, burgers, baked goods, whole foods, and more.

Environmental Impact: Every Surprise Bag equates to 2.7kg of CO2e avoided, meaning saving your favourite takeaway foods, including sushi or pizza, and reducing waste from business with surplus food is a step closer towards a greener planet.

Easy Purchase Process: The app's user-friendly interface makes it easy to browse, choose, and purchase tasty Surprise Bags filled with your favourites - from sushi to groceries.

Convenient Rescues: Collect your rescued food at the pre-set time, ensuring a hassle-free experience.

Join the Community:

Become a part of a community that believes in enjoying good surplus food while making a positive impact on the environment. Don't miss out on the opportunity to eat well and do good. Download our food recovery app now and start reducing food waste.

Reducing food waste is the #1 action you can take to help tackle climate change.
For more information, visit toogoodtogo.com/en-us/claims
