scraped_reviews.content: This app is a joke. While you can get junk food at a discount, but once you get something substantial you're paying full price for something that was made earlier that day. I paid $6.99 for a soup that was just beans, and the app claimed it was worth $21. One serving is priced at $6.99, I asked the restaurant in person when I picked up the order! They should have give me 3 orders, not one. Total rip off. Once I get my refund I will be deleting this app

It's a good idea in theory, but it seems like most of the restaurants are just using it as an additional means for sales. For example, a local restaurant just uses it to sell rice. You get a box of rice and a small soup. Every time, same thing. And they actually cook what is needed. So it's fresh, but not a value. The idea is that you should get a good quantity of leftover things that they would be throwing away anyway, not a small 'value' meal you don't even get to choose what it is.

4/5/25 I loved this app. Was using it every couple days. Until a week ago when it stopped accepting my payments methods. Doesn't matter how I try to pay it will fail. And they have absolutely no way to contact support for this issue. So I sent in a support for another issue and haven't heard back yet. 8/13/25 Still can't make purchases. Can't add debit or credit cards because I can't adjust the expiration date. Google Play always declined even when they should go through. permanently uninstall

Seems like it's a good concept, except in my area, it's the same four doughnut and pastry shops available. No matter what time of day it is, everything is sold out in the nearby area, again, a minimal selection. I've never used the application because of the lack of business participation in this area, unless driving to the Bay Area, which is 1-2 hours away.

This app was good when it started, but now it's completely deviated from what it claims to do. Businesses aren't using it to save food, they're using it to sell regular menu items on the side or just advertise themselves. The app might as well be called "Caveat Emptor." Half the surprise bags are nowhere near the advertised value that you're supposed to be getting. On rare occasions businesses run out, but in most cases (like Circle K) it's constantly happening and clearly an intentional scam.

There should be a notification system that businesses can use if they are running low on food. I didn't know there was a possibility of having your order cancelled. My very first order was cancelled maybe 20 mins before my pickup window. Suddenly having no food at 10:30pm was a huge bummer. Communication needs to be improved on this. Maybe also add a reward system for cancelled orders or penalties to businesses for last second cancellations? Definitely not what I was expecting for my first time.

A great app for getting food at a discounted price and feeling good about reducing food waste. It has been a nice way for me to discover local restaurants, bakeries and grocers near me as I recently moved to a new city. The app is straightforward and easy to use; haven't had any issues. There was an instance where I had paid for a surprise bag, but the restaurant was closed due to a hurricane power outage and the refund process was easy and handled quickly.

Friend and I tried the app for the first time, booking 4 different restaurants. Overall the value from the restaurants reported doesn't match what the app says, but what was given was worth more than paid. Marking vegetarian/vegan in the app does nothing for you if it is a surprise bag. I had vegetarian marked and if it wasn't for one restaurant asking me if I ate pork (which i don't eat red meat or pork) would have had all pork based meals. I think this app is a great idea, just needs work.

My experience with the app was fine previously, but tonight I purchased 2 surprise bags but the restaurant was closed for renovation and had no food. That's the restaurant's fault for listing when they were closed. However, when I reported the problem in the app I was given a message that they would review my message in about 2 business days. In the past they issued refunds immediately, and rightly so. I shouldn't have to wait at all! They sold me something that doesn't exist and that is theft

UI needs some finessing, notifications aren't consistent, but it's a genuinely delightful way to add spontaneous variety to regular groceries without breaking the bank, or fill up when resources are short. Picking up in the earliest part of your window means time to shop before closing, making menu coordination easier. Great way to add a thrilling surprise to the household's meal planning, for sure.

I find myself still wasting food, money, time, and gas because I don't eat seafood nor pork. It is unfortunate that you can't list food restrictions in this app. Also, by the time I open the app to see the deals, they are already gone which makes me question why I am not getting notification at the same time as everyone else. I also was expecting more food to help reduce waste than what I get. But overall, the app is a great concept!

They should fix the persistent issues with the app. It keeps asking me if I picked up my order when I have. I even have the receipt emailed to me. Also, when you click "reserve" a bag it should be "reserve" and put on hold so you can complete the transaction. It shouldn't be who clicks their payments the quickest. "Reserve" button should be called something else since it allows others to buy it right off of you if they enter their payments quicker. Good app but poor execution.

I like the idea, but there needs to be more flexibility and ease for businesses to categorize bags as vegetarian, nut-free, gluten-free, shellfish-free, vegan, etc. I would love to buy more because it's a great concept and a good deal, but I'm worried I'd get something I can't eat since I'm vegetarian and almost all places on the app also sell meat dishes. I literally don't care what's in a bag, as long as there's no meat!!! And I'm sure others would love to get that meat so......

only used the app once, and while the idea behind it is excellent, it‚Äôs not living up to its mission. The concept of reducing food waste is something I fully support, but in practice, the app falls short in several ways: 1. Limited and Repetitive Options: In my area, the selection is almost always the same ‚Äî a handful of doughnut and pastry shops or convenience stores. Major retailers like IKEA and Whole Foods are listed, but they rarely have anything available. 2. Lack of Real Discounts: When

Some places I've tried to reserve from are impossible to get. How can a place sell out EVERY DAY in literally 1 second?!? I've been waiting in the app in the restaurant's listing right when they said new items would be available, and in a split second it changes to Sold Out and to check back again tomorrow at the specific time. Very odd, a bit suspicious and so frustrating. Otherwise a great app and concept.

The concept is good. It's only good in certain major cities. Still mostly only offer bread products. it's nice that there are deli and now grocery items, but so few or so far are that they get sold out quickly or not worth the gas to get. you have to keep resetting the notifications on faves, which is a pain. some places do cancel orders all the time at the very last min as they don't actually set the items aside until right before the pickup time and waste ur time if u are on the way.

Used to be an awesome app, until they added the notifications. Now all of the bags are sold out, all of the time. I think i have managed to get 1 bag in the past 2 months. I used to get several per week. Also, every time you get a notification from a retailer, you get removed from notifications and have to sign up again. I will probably just delete the app soon. It's not worth the hassle anymore.

It's a good idea. You have to pay ahead of time. Packages are "good" and not "amazing" for their prices. Feels like they should all cost a little less than they do. Wish there was a way to have it delivered as the pickup time windows are pretty inconvenient. There is only a small selection of businesses to choose from and I would like to see a lot more. There is no option to ignore a business you aren't interested in. Can't browse by zip code, needs GPS! No dark mode. Overall a lot wrong.

I check the app every day, making a purchase every few days or weekly from multiple stores. However, a couple of weeks back, the app would not allow any form of payment be it from CCs, Google Pay, or a debit card. Both logging out and in, and reinstalling the app did not work. Reaching out to support and got a response to contact my banks for a resolution (something about the new 3D security feature for all payments). Almost deleted app!Creating a "new" account with another email address works.

Great way to save food that's still good 95% of the time. Boxes started out gigantically cheap, but got more expensive along the way, it really depends on the store/restaurant. Maybe a future update could include photos made by stores so customers can choose the most fitting box for them? The parcels are a nice addition, especially since you can see what you're gonna get. The new update makes it possible to assemble a parcel yourself, which is amazing! Absolutely love the idea!!!

The idea for the app is great ONLY. I've seen restaurants I haven't before and I think that's why most of them joined, for the advertisement not because they have a surplus of food. I've been to restaurants where they give you the barrel of their menus. The scraps and gravy while open. It would have been a difference if they were closing and had to get rid of it. But being fully open with another 1hr-2hrs left to go means it was not the surplus it was the advertisement you wanted.

[Edit] 2‚≠ê Great concept, with a dysfunctional app. Under each tab, only a few choices are shown out of what's actually available. There is no way to contact Ex. Tab "pick up today" shows 4 choices But then under other tabs, many more options are actually available "today". I don't want to spend half an hour checking each and every tab, to find what should've been under the 1st tab. (1st review) 5‚≠ê Delicious healthy food. Quick in store ordering and if you order ahead, instant pick up.

Not worth the time. I love the idea of not letting food go to waste by selling at a discounted price. However, this app, or at least with my experiences so far in WNY, have left much to be desired. So far 2 places said they're not associated with this app, so they were a bust and wasted an hr of my life. Then the next said $5 for 15 worth of food, but only gave me 7 in items. Again a waste of a trip. I've spent more in gas than the app saves.

The value of 3√ó the original price was provided in ~270 of my 300+ orders since autumn 2020. These savings often aren't worth the time to get the meal, potential cancellations, the scheduling in accordance with the collection times, and accustoming to the predetermined portion sizes for every meal, at every store every day. But no one's forcing you to use the app more than your schedule allows for. So I think there are only positives to using the app as long as you are in the right mood for it.

Great concept. I don't use it often as most times you get what you pay for. Stores give you processed food that's expiring that day. Another place gave what tasted like stale cupcakes taken out of the fridge. At one place they loaded up the container with 80% rice and covered the top with some protein and veggies to make it look like you're getting lots of food. There are good stories though. At three places they truly give you what regular customers get because pickup time is near closing time.

notifications don't work at all, they never come through and reset every time you use the app. I've never been able to even use this service because everything except gross overly sweet donuts is always sold out. the restaurants I have saved and notifications on for are never available and when I click it always says "just missed! turn on notifications!" but their notifications DO NOT WORK. this app is a waste of time.

Good app but when reviewing Favorites and you click on one to see the location, when you go back to the list it takes you right back to the top so then you have to scroll all the way through to get back to where you were. Also, Favorites should be sorted by distance to current location maybe (or make it sortable) - the Fave list is displayed so randomly right now. Also, most places I've been to aren't selling excess/leftover food - they're using the app as just another way to get orders!

Options are not reliable enough to depend on for necessities, per se. A large number of participating locations are donut or other occasional bakery-types. But the discounted values are well worth it at most locations, the user support is helpful, and it feels very much for a good cause if you have a distaste for food waste. Don't expect to necessarily get what you want if you're picky, but if you're not picky, expect generally decent variety and quality.

Pick up times can vary per location and sometimes you can't see the pick up time until they have something to buy.A lot falls on the businesses to be transparent. Might like a message system so customers know of issues ahead of time. I was confused when places disappear on the map because it's hard to know who is on the app until they have offers available. Sucks when a place has decent stuff but bad customer service. I've had no issue with the app itself.

My job has me travel around San Diego county, and I can always find a good prepared food choice everywhere I go. The app allows me to select from many restaurants, grocery stores and production kitchens. I have found great choices ( and 1 or 2 mediocre choices) from the many available options. The grocery options always amaze me, and sometimes amuse me. With the app, I have significantly lowered what I spend on groceries and meals on the go.

I've enjoyed my time using this app so far. The selection is really based on what's available in your area, and your willingness to accept a "surprise" bag. If I have a critique it's that I'd much rather know that a store has specific leftovers at the end of a day, rather than keep my finders crossed that it's not something I have an allergy to.

I enjoy using this app. It has introduced me to restaurants that I never heard of or never would have tried on my own. Once I learned how to select locations, I started to use the app while traveling to different cities. One time I was getting gas, turned on the app and discovered that I was near a business that was on the app. I was able to pick up a Top Good TP Go bag and was very pleased with the contents. Some places are very generous with what they pack.

The app is good, but why do I have to reset my notifications for every favorite, every time? You said one time toggle, it's not. Sometimes I don't get to the offer in time, or don't want it that day, but that doesn't mean I never want it again. If I set up a notification, it should indeed be only once, not every time a notice goes out. Fix this and you'll get a better review.

Genuinely one of the most useful and fun apps out there, the surprise factor is super addicting. It saves so much perfectly good food from being trashed. Some of the bags are insane: I once got over $80 worth of pastries for $7 üòÆ every item worth more than the whole bag!! If every restaurant used Too Good To Go, we‚Äôd cut food waste, save a ton of money, and walk away way happier (and fatter!).

I love this idea and this service! I hope more and more restaurants keep doing this! it's so amazing to help out local places with their extra stock and get a price cut too. I would normally not be able to visit these places and I'm glad this way I can! I recommend the places here first when others ask where to go for food. Since anyone on this platform has good social, food and community awareness. Plus, they still get to make money from stuff that would've been a loss for them. love it!

I love the concept & I have gotten some incredible food deals thru the app. 4 stars because I've sent 2 messages to their support email re: 2 separate questions & no one even bothered to reply. Do better, guys. You have a great app, but customer service should be a part of it, even if you're new. Super unprofessional.

I love this app !! I love the thrill of not knowing what im getting. I havent been disappointed yet!! I think this would be a fun date night experiance of even hanging out with friends. For me I order out a lot being busy so this was right up my alley. The food is always fresh, restaurant staff always nice and polite. Plus I have places to order from in the future !!

Easy to use app and does what you need it to do. Excellent way to help both businesses recoup some cost and reduce food waste while also helping the community get cheap food. My experiences so far as a customer have been great. I haven't seen a business be super stingy on cost-to-quantity ratio yet, with the deals always being good offers. Easy to find local business that offer it too.

love the concept, and customer service is great. I would like the ability to hide restaurants I never want to see, especially if I've had a poor experience. there is one lady in town who just runs a bakery out of her condo and she is clearly making food to sell on the app, not selling leftovers. I am going to the app far less often since I have to wade through her dozen listings every day. Google even shows she's out of business!

If you haven't tried Too Good To Go, you are missing out. Great way to save funds, get great meals or treats, and save food from being wasted. It's super easy to use and has a variety of businesses to choose from. Options do go fast, but that's because the deals are outstanding!

The service too good to go provides is spectacular. The app, however, is not. It lacks many features that would seemingly be easy to implement. You can't ignore stores, with simple actions such as filtering and searching needing a click or two too many. A shame that a great service can only by used through a shoddy app. Edit: latest update introduced ai translation of listing and you can't turn it off (there's a 'show original ' button but it doesn't work)

The app's pretty basic (doesn't always work). More importantly, they don't actually add the referral or any promotional amounts to your account. Just a sales gimmick. Moreover, they haven't been able to move the needle much in all this time in getting more establishments on board. They ask for referrals but don't manage to close on any eateries around a very busy neighborhood. Very strange but also what's to be expected from a European outfit, unfamiliar with how American business works.

Some good experiences, some bad (stale food, original prices are a lie so you're paying close to normal price for old food) but the most recent experience of barely missing a short pickup window because I was expecting the usual notification from the app that didn't come, has turned me against it. When going to support for the issue, there is no refund offered, I just threw away my money for food I didn't get that was wasted anyway, and a generic form letter from support. They don't care.

Almost a perfect app. Lots of stores in my area, some amazing deals, and it helped me discover new places I frequent now! All that it holding it back is the fact that I can't seem to hide locations I'm not interested in. Most of my options are cluttered with Circle K. No offense to them, but I will never, ever want their stuff, so please just let me hide.

great deals, a great way to sample new restaurants, and it's always nice to get surprises! There many more customers than participating restaurants in my area so the bags go fast & we have to travel 20-30 mins for most of the restaurants near me, so im not sure the realistic carbon saved is super great in our case, but i can imagine this would be amazing in a larger city.

Love the concept of zero-wasted food! So far I've purchased from bakeries (donuts) and it's been great deals. I would only go for places with 4.5+ star reviews. Everything else...you get what you pay for. Search function could use a lot of work. They should really let you search through all options instead of having to check each category. Also you can't even filter by pick-up time.

Prices used to be worth it. Now some places are charging the same for a meal. 8.99, 10.99 Whats the point of the app if you're just another way to order pick up? I was under the assumption it was discounts for things they did not sell and was not supposed to be junk. The prices are just silly. I can just call for a to-go order and pick it up when I want. The only difference here is the time restrictions. It's really sad to see a great idea turn into a way for sellers manipulate buyers.

I love the concept, but the app needs work. I've opened it so many times, but the only things that are ever available are baked goods. It claims other businesses are offered, but they never show available or are always sold out. I wonder if they ever really have anything. This new requirement of always having GPS enabled or you can't see anything, even restaurants you favorites, is stupid! I'm deleting this useless app that just takes up space.

Generally, it's OK. More than once, the food I have picked up has mold on it the next day. They also don't do the bare minimum of making sure store locations are accessible during the pickup window‚ÄîI couldn't find parking for one of my recent pickups, despite being there ten minutes after the window opened. It was only a half hour window, so driving around for twenty minutes looking for parking meant I missed the pickup. Customer service refused a refund. Hope the employees enjoyed my food.

I really like this app and the idea behind it, saving food waste. I've gotten a few offers and was happy with the food I received over the last year or so, however; since I moved there are no stores in my area. The offers provided by the stores are limited. I know the stores choose to participate and it's not the app or the app makers fault. But because of this, I'm giving 3 stars. If they added more stores, I would give a higher rating.

title: Hevy - Gym Log Workout Tracker
description:
Get strong by logging your workouts and tracking your progress with Hevy - for free! Hevy has been designed to be the simplest, most intuitive workout tracker in the world. No ads and free. Log your gym workout, get extensive statistics to track your progress over time, and join a growing community of athletes. Hevy is the perfect weightlifting tracker and planner that will allow you to reach your fitness goals.

Workout Log & Gym Tracker Planner App

‚Ä¢ Track your lifts with an intuitive, simple to use interface. ‚Ä¢ Plan and log your routines with the advanced routine planner ‚Ä¢ Use the calendar to stay on top of your training schedule ‚Ä¢ Hundreds of exercises with free high-quality videos for you to focus on your form ‚Ä¢ Follow your friend's progress by following their lifts and copying their routines ‚Ä¢ Create your own custom exercises for your workouts ‚Ä¢ Mark sets as Warmup, Normal, Drop sets, Failure and Supersets ‚Ä¢ Customize automatic rest timers ‚Ä¢ Analyze your gym sessions in detail with muscle group graphs ‚Ä¢ Calculation of One Rep Max ‚Ä¢ Create an unlimited amount of routines ‚Ä¢ Analyze the progression of your lifts with beautiful full-screen graphs of volume, best weight & total reps ‚Ä¢ Copy your friends' workouts

Wear OS Watch

‚Ä¢ Easily track your workouts on your Wear OS Watch ‚Ä¢ Use your Hevy routines on your Wear OS Watch ‚Ä¢ Live sync your Wear OS Watch workout with your phone ‚Ä¢ Use Hevy Wear OS Tile to easily access Hevy ‚Ä¢ Keep track of your heart rate during your workout ‚Ä¢ Helpful timers for duration exercises ‚Ä¢ Mark sets as Warmup, Normal, Drop sets, or Failure ‚Ä¢ Watch workouts automatically save when reconnecting to your phone

What Users Are Saying

‚Ä¢ "Seriously the best gym fitness tracker I've ever used. Simple. Free. Tons of graphs. Amazing quality videos" - Sam Ilelaboye ‚Ä¢ "Seeing what my friends and other athletes are working out at the gym has totally changed my experience. Now I can log my friend's workouts and compare myself. It's super motivating" - James ‚Ä¢ "Tracking my workouts with Hevy has taken my fitness to the next level, I'm getting stronger every week. Being able to use the workout planner really helps me being efficient at the gym." - Carlos D.

Using a Tracker for Training

‚Ä¢ The gym log can be used for a variety of different training types such as heavy weight lifting, powerlifting, olympic exercises, 5x5, strength training, stronglifts, crossfit, and bodybuilding. ‚Ä¢ Track your routines like 3 day workout split, full body split, bodybuilding routines, 5x5, upper lower, and push pull legs. ‚Ä¢ Also perfect for bodyweight workouts such as calisthenics, cardio tracking and HIIT. ‚Ä¢ Use it as a gym tracker & workout journal planner to keep track of your gym sessions over time. ‚Ä¢ Create gym routines or home workouts and use the routine planner to prepare your sessions ahead of time ‚Ä¢ Whether your goal is to increase your strength in weightlifting exercises, lose weight, or improve your level of fitness, Hevy helps you to stay on track with a gym planner. ‚Ä¢ Easily see your previous lift values, this helps you with progressive overload training. ‚Ä¢ Carefully follow proper form with +200 exercise videos such as Bench Press, Squat and Deadlift ‚Ä¢ Filter exercises by muscle groups and equipment type Whether you‚Äôre doing strength training at the gym or home workouts, trying to improve your fitness or to get strong, join Hevy workout log and be a part of the community! CONTACT US ‚Ä¢ https://www.hevyapp.com ‚Ä¢ https://www.instagram.com/hevyapp ‚Ä¢ https://www.facebook.com/hevyapp ‚Ä¢ https://www.twitter.com/hevyapp ‚Ä¢ hello@hevyapp.com Download Hevy and take your training to the next level! Disclaimer: The Hevy app is not affiliated with any other workout tracker, workout planner, gym log or fitness apps like; Strong, Jefit, 5x5, Fitbud, my fitness pal, Fitbit, or Heavyset.

Get strong by logging your workouts and tracking your progress with Hevy - for free!

Hevy has been designed to be the simplest, most intuitive workout tracker in the world. No ads and free. Log your gym workout, get extensive statistics to track your progress over time, and join a growing community of athletes.
Hevy is the perfect weightlifting tracker and planner that will allow you to reach your fitness goals.

summary: Gym Log & Workout Tracker | Fitness Journal, Training & Weight Lifting Planner

scraped_reviews.content: Awesome workout tracking app. I'm using the free version and it has been great. It is stable. Allows the selection of tons of exercises. The interface is very well designed... I'm a developer and trust me that is not an easy accomplishment. Usually I see tons of design problems and missing features... but hevy is solid... I can only find tiny nitpicks... like I wish all bodyweight exercises tracked volume instead of just sets/reps... but it looks like they might be working on that.

This is the best workout logger I've seen. Very intuitive, everything does what I would have designed it to do. It has a bunch of built in routines that are easy to modify based on your desires or available equipment. It has a social side where you can see what other folks are doing, follow friends and comment on their workouts. Easy setup to send your workout to other apps.

I use the monthly paid version ($2.99 a month), and it's exactly what I needed in a workout tracking app. Plenty of pre-loaded exercises with animations and how-to descriptions if you need a reminder, plus the ability to create custom exercises. I also enjoy being able to take a workout plan from the app and edit it as needed. Support is also responsive and timely!

not perfect. it doesn't have every possible exercise or every variation, but it does allow you to create exercises, and though the creation method isn't %100 comprehensive, it works with most exercises. also, it won't allow you to put more than two exercises in a single superset, which is slightly annoying, but doesn't really affect the results. overall not bad, and helps track improvement. edit-just found that I can only save 4 workouts and create 7 exercises until hitting paywall. down 1 star.

Amazing app. Though I use the free version, it's a great app! Even allowing you to create your own workout. Love the effective tracking of time, love how the timer starts as soon as you hit the checkmark, and the loud ring that let's you know when your next set begins. Plenty of already built in workouts, and an encouraging concept to highlight workouts with a personal record badge. This app is well put together, and runs smoothly. No need for any workout app.

For a beginner, this is the perfect app that offers all the basics of what you need in a simple and user-friendly product. Unlike other apps I don't find myself having to scroll through a lot of fluff. I also love the ability to add customized activities, and create notes that will stick to an app so I can remember specific advice. Lifetime purchase!

Very new to weight training. I wanted a super simple way to track without any fluff. there is a social component but it's easy to ignore if desired. The workouts are REALLY easy to create and to track, exactly what I'm looking for. It's easy to swap exercises which is great for a newby who's not sure what they can/can't attempt yet. I really like this app.

I used stronglifts 5x5 several times before switching to Heavy when SL became a fully paid app. The switch was easy since there was a 5x5 template already there. After each workout you get a highlight (personal best or stat). adding custom routines is a breeze. Warmup reps are typically included. Another nice part of the free version is plate calculator.

absolutely love this app for tracking exercise. I use to use an excel spread sheet but I like the variety of exercises I can add easy to a workout plan or if I wanna add an extra set to a movement. the little "you lifted x amount of weight! thats like lifting a car/truck/etc." its cute and makes me feel strong and wanting to push harder

This app is extraordinary. Theres really not much more I need to say. I never review apps, even if my offered free stuff, but I just felt that more people need to see this transformative app. It has so many great features making it perfect when Im working out. Incredible free and payed version! This app has definitely been one of the main reasons why I‚Äôve gotten healthier and gained muscle. DOWNLOAD THIS APP!!!!!!!!!!! I promise you'll thank yourself later. Also, have a good day‚ò∫Ô∏è

I tried lots of free workout training apps and Hevy is the best by a wide margin. Tracking workouts is made incredibly easy and there's so many interesting statistics that you can use to track your progress. Hevy has helped tremendously on my current bulk. My only gripe with this app is the social media aspect of it. I don't like seeing random people on my feed when I'm trying to look at me and my girlfriend's workouts, but it's not a big deal and can be easily ignored. I 100% recommend this app

Best workout app I have. And I was skeptical. I've always kept a journal to track my progress. I didn't want to be the person "on their phone in the gym". This app has changed how I workout. New exercises, timer to keep track of rest between sets, pre-loaded workouts (if you subscribe, which is relatively inexpensive compared to other apps). As much as I didn't want to use my phone during workouts, this app has changed everything for me. I won't workout without it.

The new update has degraded the app slightly. For timed exercises, in order to put in a time you now have to use a time wheel instead of direct input. I have no idea why they changed that. Also, for some exercises, like planks, it doesn't keep the time you selected last time for that exercise when you go to do it again, so you have to select a time again for each set.

Good app. The system is very intuitive and simple. You can save workouts as routines, so you just make one routine for each of your days. You can also make custom workouts in case the app doesn't have the one you are doing. The one gripe I have is the pro version is very expensive. it's $80 for a lifetime subscription and the pro gives you features that I feel like an app should give you for free. The free app restricts you to 4 routines which if you do a PPL UL split then you got a problem.

Hevy is a game-changer for workout tracking! The interface is intuitive, making it super easy to log exercises, track progress, and customize routines. I love the detailed stats and graphs that show my strength gains over time. The community feature is a nice touch, letting me connect with friends for motivation. It syncs seamlessly with my devices, and the exercise library is massive, covering everything I need.

Really solid app. I‚Äôve been using it to track all my workouts, and it‚Äôs made things way easier. I can log my sets, reps, and weights, and see my progress over time. Super helpful for staying consistent. It‚Äôs also nice just having everything in one place‚Äîno more messy notes or trying to remember what I did last time. If you're trying to keep your fitness organized, this app does the job

Really good app! I applaud the developers in making this app so focused on inclusion of as many exercises as possible. I love the ability to make and log your own routines while inputting the exact amount of sets, reps, and occasionally other useful information. This app does a good job of helping you record, analyze, and push your workouts to their limits. The reason I didn't give this 5 stars may seem stingy, but I'm a sucker for open-source software, which this sadly isn't. Great app though!

in a recent update they changed how to enter time for time based exercises. it is extremely annoying if you are doing intervals and entering several sets. it's just a FAR less efficient way to enter the time. in general, I like this app, but that one change is infinitely annoying for me. giving it a low rating for that, hoping that they see it and change it back to the way it was... then I'll give it the rating that I believe the rest of the app deserves (much higher)

This app shows me that a lot of thinking was done when making it. I feel very motivated even when I haven't been able to be constant. it doesn't show your failures but your gains. It keeps things positive and goal oriented. It's easy to use and has lots of routines for when you don't have your own or simply want to change things one day (period week or something). I love it. Also, it connects perfectly with my smart watch.

****EDIT: Can I PLEASE type in the duration of a cardio workout? The selector tool for hrs/ min/ seconds is dumb Bangarang! This app is seriously awesome. And free? Geez I'm upgrading to say "thanks" - LOVE that it's so simple. If you can figure out how to add an exercise, you pretty much know 80% of what you need to in order to start kicking butt. -LOVE that for each exercise it automatically brings up the sets and notes from the previous time I did it. + the ability to check my progress

This app has tons of exercises and is super simple. You can log everything while your working out super fast and the feeling you get when you beat your record is awesome. I really appreciate the small achievement things that pop up and how it shows your previous records. It makes this app that much better. The graphs they provide are also awesome. This app is really worth it.

I really like this app because it is exactly what I am looking for and it is not heavily behind the paywall. Plus, I enjoy looking at the progress of me and my friends workout. Adding a photo of workout progress after the session is pretty neat to add. The only thing I have issues with this app that there's some exercises that isn't being listed and tutorials is kinda limited to understand.

EDIT (9/30/2025): can no longer log workouts between on the watch during an active workout. EDIT (7/10/2025): after the previous update this app has some serious delay on tapping things. Fantastic app. Main thing id like to request is integration into the apple and samsung health apps so that workouts are tracked in those apps along with calories burned. For tracking lifts its great and very easy to use.

Love it! I use this app every time I go to the gym. It tracks all of my workouts and progress really well. Its really rewarding to look back on my progress and see how much im lifting. There is almost no lift it doesn't have for you to add to your routines. I love how personalized I can make it such as adding notes, different rest times, etc... I wish I could add more workout routines than just 4 but its all I really need. I also wish more people were on the app!

This app is outstanding. It has its flaws and they can be really annoying. At least two machines are missing on the list and is not easy to add something "more or less the same" and rename it and then next session find it easily. And the sync with the watch is really bad. Once you are at the gym you dont want to waste time with your phone or tech you want to do your routine. Sadly if you start the routine in your watch is super hard to change exercise and you cant switch to your phone.

Simple. Easy and I have yet to not find an exercise in the database. One of the best features is even after I set a routine, I can switch out exercises without changing the routine. Also, of a machine or bench isnt available, swapping out an exercise for a other is the easiest process I've seen in any app. Same thing with putting together supersets.

Honestly, this is one of the best workout apps I've used so far. Not because it's jam-packed with features but instead because they don't force you into a subscription model just to do simple things (they even have a permanent option). It lets you do all the things the average gym bro needs to do to track their workouts all for free and if you want to go beyond that then you can pay for premium. It even has a whole social media tab to share your workouts and progress. tldr: Great app üëç

Its great to have the option to use it on the watch, but is incredibly hard to switch exercise. The machines or spaces are not always free in order to follow a routine literally so you jump to another machine meanwhile, but change that on the watch is almost impossible. That's the worst frustration. Going to the phone to do it there, the exercise will start from scratch and then the watchexersize sometimes will be ignored

This app has been an excellent tool for my fitness journey. About six months ago I decided to start lifting weights seriously to build muscle. This app allows me to create custom workout routines that fit my goals and to track my sets, reps, and weight for every exercise. It also provides a lot of motivating stats and encouragement at the end of my workouts. I highly recommend this app to anyone who wants to accurately track their workout progress. I do not use any of the social sharing aspect.

Great first experience! From my very first use, I was very impressed and pleasantly surprised! Found all but 1 exercise when creating my first routine. The features are really cool! (too many to list here) I can't believe you get so much for free. Even though I think I don't really need the "Pro" version, I may just get to support. Nice job! Thanks Guillem!

It's much better than the paper log I started out with. I don't use the social functions much and have pared it down to just myself and a pair of friends. I do wish there was a way to compare entire workout sessions against each other but I haven't found that functionality in the app or the desktop site. My friends do think the muscle group highlight dummy is terrifying like Blucifer in Denver. But for everything I need in the gym this works well. It could use a better tour though.

I have struggled with body dysmorphia all my life, and I finally decided I would do something about it to make my life better for myself. This app is brilliant. It's easy to use, expertly made, and it even praises you after each workout, which is huge for me! It gives you that boost of encouragement and reminds you of your progress, celebrating every win. It's been a life changer for me and I'm only on week 4! This is a great app for people wanting to do good for themselves! :)

Got recommended this app to track workouts a month or two ago and have been using it every workout since then. After using Excel for years, this is so much easier and more detailed. I like preparing routines ahead of time, including rest times and set types (warm up, regular, etc), plus being able to enter custom lifts if you can't find one you're looking for in the library or want to make something unique for yourself. The analytics are interesting, and it's made working out better than ever. D

Simple, perfect. too many workout apps make you select a routine as well as a fitness level. They are very hard to use if you already know what you want to do, or if you have a routine prescribed by a physical therapist, or personal trainer. This is the app that solves that problem, and it is wonderful. However, it also offers popular routines that others have developed in case you need that jump-start.

As a beginner in the gym, this is the perfect app for me! I tried a few others, but this has been the most helpful and easiest to use. I like that it shows me my progress over time, I can search by muscle type and it shows how to do the exercise, and it has a built in rest timer. It syncs with my watch so I can track my workout there, or on my phone. It has everything I was looking for in a tracking app!

very intuitive app. super user friendly. super easy to track your progress especially if you're on the paid version (I recommend you do the paid version) it has almost every workout option you can imagine. only thing I'd like to see added is if they had included more substitutions say if a machine was down. "we recommend subbing this instead" theyre are a few but I'd like to really branch and learn other ways of targeting groups.

This a perfect app to start tracking your workouts. The UI is really simple and after the first try, you want to keep going to your routines and editing them and adding more. I love the help in case of trying out a new workout. It shows you how it should be done. I use this app almost every day (I have to be more disciplined, I know) but trust me that this app is a must if you're trying to push to the next level of your fitness journey.

I just bought a lifetime license to support the developer. I honestly don't 'need' the pro features (though extras are nice), as the free version does just about everything I could want. It supports super sets--not stuck on one exercise at a time, the wearos app is simple and fantastic, I can manually add any exercise that isn't already there, and there are no ads. It even syncs with Samsung Health via Health Connect. Great job to the team, and thanks for making a great product for lifters.

Really good free workout app. Includes lots of workouts and routines you can start for free. You can track your weight every day and compare your progress. I really enjoy this app ad ot helps me track my workouts and try new ones. I also appreciate that the app allows you to use just about everything without having to pay, and paying will give you extra features and an extension to a lot of features.

I've been using hevy for a year now, and its by far my favorite workout tracking app. I've used my gyms app, strong, another app that I don't remember the name of, my notes app, and notebook tracking. hevy is easiest to use and has the best options for exercises and you can add your own if its not in there. gives you a year end data like a spotify wrapped.

this is a great app. tracking workouts is fun and easy, and the feedback from the app is motivational. one important feature they absolutely nailed is the ease with which I can find exercises. for example, searching "strict press" or "military press" will find what hevy calls this exercise, overhead press. overall a wonderful app and I'll be subscribing to pro soon

If you're serious about your fitness, health, and progress, USE THIS APP. I've tracked 100 workouts so far, and have paid for the Pro Version ($3 a month) and think the app is quality both free and paid. All my gym friends use Hevy to track their workouts too! Im so happy to have shown them, as keeping each other on track has been a ton of fun as we progress I dont review apps often, but coming from business management I know the impact reviews can have. Believe me, Hevy holds it's weight!

Decent. Needs better notes and less socializing. You can enter notes (machine settings etc.) but they randomly get deleted, so you still need a clipboard or something in the gym to keep track. Tries way too hard to push socializing with random users. I just want to build clean workouts, push progressive overload, and track overall progress - I don't want to be inundated with follow suggestions in the main feed.

easy app to use. I really like being able to track my weight in a lift and see how I improved whether its with more reps or adding more weight. used it for 25 workouts now and really enjoying it. I have the monthly subscription (which you only need if you want to save multiple work out routines) but considering the lifetime which I love having that option so I dont have to have a subscription.

Works exactly how I would like a gym tracker to work, which is high praise. The UI is intuitive and works well for both planned and ad-hoc workouts. I love that it makes tips and history for each exercise easy to access. And the way that phone and Pixel Watch sync is spot on ‚Äì you can use both seamlessly. Only request is for heart rate to sync to Strava, and for workout details to go into the private notes field in Strava. Otherwise it's basically perfect üëè

I'm a beginner and this app has been really valuable for me. I especially like the instructions and animations included for each exercise. I started with beginner routines and have made some customizations as I learn and gain experience. I have one suggestion that would make this app perfect for me: add stretches and stretching routines. Thank you!

As a 66 year old, first time gym member, this app has been great for me. I find that it keeps me focused and helps me progressively lift heavier each week. No more random workouts. I am seeing great results and only 3 months in. If needed, I can review the proper form for an exercise. I'm loving this app!

Has all the features I want in a workout tracker. Can edit easily in the middle of a workout. Can easily group different workouts via folders for easy switching. I also love how easy it is to go back and see what exercises and weights were used previously. Killer workout app and I won't switch any time soon, if ever.

Great app for managing routines and workouts. Wishing there would be a way to see a body muscle map for a routine while editing it, to check what muscle groups are hit. Since there are no "programs" and only folders, it would be great to have a program option, with the same feature to see a muscle map for the program

I've never had the motivation to work out or to help myself up until recently after finding this app. I bought the premium or plus thing or whatever without hesitation. This app has been most helpful and most guiding without even needing the subscription. Soon, I'll no longer be that fat, annoying kid, but rather that annoying kid built like a truck. Thank you, Hevy!

descriptionHTML:
BIGO LIVE - The Ultimate Live Streaming Platform
Join over 500M people worldwide on BIGO LIVE, where entertainment meets connection.

What You Can Enjoy:
‚àö Discover Exciting Live Streams: Watch high-quality, round-the-clock streams tailored to your interests, from chatting, dancing, and singing to gaming and beyond.
‚àö Feel the Warm Community Vibes: Step into any live room to enjoy friendly chats, instant interactions, and warm welcomes from a vibrant global community.
‚àö Create Meaningful Connections: Break the ice with video chats, voice calls, or fun interactive games, and build friendships that truly matter.
‚àö Shine as a Star: Do what you love‚Äîwhether it's sharing your talents or simply chatting. Get applause, followers, and rewards, even without showing your face.

Key Features:
- LiveStreams: Swipe to explore live streams across various categories and engage in real-time with virtual gifts and live chats.
- Multi-guest Live (Live Video Chat): Team up with up to 11 friends, watch YouTube videos together, discuss trending topics, and enjoy games like "Draw and Guess."
- Audio Live (Live Voice Chat): Meet interesting people worldwide through audio-only conversations, anytime and anywhere.
- Live PK: Compete with friends or enjoy as a viewer, experiencing exciting penalties for the losing team in fun-filled challenges.
- Go Live: Start streaming with one tap, choosing from Game LIVE, Audio LIVE, or Multi-guest LIVE to share your world in your style.

‚àö 8+ Years of Excellence

SplashLearn is the award-winning learning app trusted by over 59 million parents and teachers. Built for kids ages 2‚Äì11 and designed for PreK to Grade 5, it transforms screen time into fun learning across math, reading, and more. From learning games for 2 year olds to 5th grade math and reading, SplashLearn adapts to every child‚Äôs level. üìñ Reading:

- Start with the abc song, phonics song, and early letter practice like letter tracing and alphabet tracing.

scraped_reviews.replyContent: That‚Äôs amazing to hear. Sounds like your daughter is absolutely thriving, and we love that SplashLearn is a part of her learning journey! And yes, while it‚Äôs not entirely free, we‚Äôre glad you‚Äôre finding value in it. Big cheers to her for scoring the highest in her class.

scraped_reviews.content: This is the best app that I look around in Google Play Store or Apple app Store. The best learning app for my kids who are in 1st grade and 2nd grade. It helping my kids in learning math while having fun with math. Wish this app could have been launched in 90's how easy will be math for me as well. I will definitely recommend this app to parents who wants their kids to be ahead from other kids in the class while having fun learning.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you very much for your 5-star review!!!

scraped_reviews.content: This app is nearly impossible to cancel. Be cautious. You jump through hoops. Kept trying to charge. Then, I went to my account and said they couldn't find the package I was on. ( which I wasn't on one) I just did the free trial and wanted to cancel. So frustrating. The app itself is great. The ease to cancel is not.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear about your frustration with the cancellation process. Your experience matters to us, and we're here to help make it right. Please reach out to us at feedback@splashlearn.com, and we‚Äôll assist you in resolving this as quickly as possible. Thank you for sharing your feedback

scraped_reviews.content: Subscribed for this learning application for my grandson but we have never been able to access the learning platform. I paid an annual subscription but canceled. Tried contacting them but ran into problems and can't resolve the issue. I'll just take my losses but IF you're thinking of using this app ... think twice.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: This is not the level of service we aim to provide, and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused. Please reach out to us at feedback@splashlearn.com with your account details so we can resolve this issue promptly.

scraped_reviews.content: Terrible customer service. I have been trying to reach someone through email (the only contact information listed) for a month with no response. The app itself is fine but I had to cancel my subscription because I couldn't get help with account management after being charged for 2 separate subscriptions instead of 2 kids on a single account.

My daughter school uses this app. She been using it for over a year. Just recently there been issues that either the math area or language arts area doesnt show up. Today my daughter the math didnt show up at all there are usually 3 buttons on top and only 2 popped up . Some of my daughter's classmates are having trouble accessing stuff that the teacher gives to them. I have the paid version .
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello,
Could you please send us more information about your issue? You can contact us at help@splashlearn.com. We'll be happy to look at this for you.
Thanks!

scraped_reviews.content: good overall. my kids really like to play the games. it's easy for them to get out of the assigned math game that I picked and into something more fun of their choice. I like the small incremental levels so you can know exactly where your child is at. and I like that you can easily change between different grade levels if needed. I would recommend this as a great preK supplement program.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review! We're glad your kids enjoy the games and that you find the level progression and grade flexibility helpful. Thank you for recommending us.

scraped_reviews.content: for two days now the app will not load I paid for this and would appreciate it if someone looks into this for me. I tried everything with no luck. it's not just my phone it won't work on and of the 3 PCs we have , or and of our 4 laptops, or tablets as well. our Internet is fine we have fairly new devices on the more expensive side as well so it's not any of our devices.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We‚Äôre sorry you‚Äôre facing this issue, and we understand how frustrating it must be, especially with an active subscription. The issue you've described isn‚Äôt expected behavior. Please contact us at feedback@splashlearn.com with your account details and any error messages you've encountered. We‚Äôll look into it right away.

scraped_reviews.content: Awesome app for kids! My little one has been struggling with speech, but with SplashLearn, the fun games and colorful activities have really helped her. She‚Äôs more excited about learning now, and I‚Äôve noticed she‚Äôs starting to pick up more words. The app adjusts to her speed, so no pressure. Highly recommend for parents looking to support their kids in a fun and engaging way
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're so glad SplashLearn has been a fun and helpful tool in your little one's learning journey. Watching kids gain confidence and improve their skills while having fun is exactly what we strive for! Thank you for your recommendation, and happy learning!

title: Bowmasters: Archery Shooting
description:
A brand new version of the world-famous multiplayer game with bowmen! 

If you like exciting shooting games, gun games, especially archery games, join the fun and unique battles in the action game Bowmasters! Here you will find various types of arrows, hone your archery skills in unusual duels, and you will be able to compete for first place in a multiplayer games for skilled archers. Shoot from your favorite bow and become a legendary shooter!

Features of the shooting game Bowmasters:

- 60+ INSANE CHARACTERS from all dimensions absolutely for free! Try everyone and choose the archer you want to play.

- 60+ DIFFERENT WEAPONS for total mayhem, also awesome fatalities with rag-doll physics! We assure you, not all gun games have such a choice. Take a gun and make an accurate shot!

- MULTIPLE GAME MODES. Sho–æt birds or fruits down, defeat the enemies in duels and get money for that! Aim and hit the bull's eye!

- ENDLESS REWARDS FOR YOUR SKILLS! Do you like not only to play action games, but also to get rewards? Welcome! Take everything if you can!

- UNIVERSAL SEASON PASS: 5 season passes for archery so you can shoot without limits.

Shooter, don‚Äôt miss out on the fun! Be the first archer in action battles in multiplayer shooting games. Get your bow, grab an arrow, and dive into archery and gun shooting in Bowmasters! You'll see, shooter games have never been so exciting!
