contentRatingDescription: Violence, Blood and Gore, Suggestive Themes

scraped_reviews.content: It's definitely been a while since I last played this, and I have to say. It hasn't changed a bit. The Youtube version of this is better due to it being ad free, but unlike this, that is limited and not graphic cuz we all know why. I give this 2 stars (really 1.5) because I dislike the ads heavily and the amount of pressure to put money into this to unlock characters and subscriptions. Even the flying decoy ruins the game. Remove it, please. AI has a chance to go through it while I can't.

Fun while you play, so im a play pass member, so I get good stuff in game. Problem is that theres like always something new some new pop up here and there , you cant just jump in and play , when i turn it on I see a new game mode, a new reward, some other pop up asking me to click. I just wanna shoot. The game is quirky and fun, but I had to uninstall cause I just can't deal with that part of the loop, it slows down time between levels.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Sorry to hear about that problem. Our development team will try to solve the issue in the shortest time possible. Thank you for finding out time and sharing your feedback!

scraped_reviews.content: developer don't care about our complaints about the unnecessary number of ads. you get ADS even when you want to turn off the music and return to the game, developers says tells us more about the bug!? stop playing dumb, we are talking about the number of ads and all they say is "stay tuned for future updates. I ain't holding my breath. uninstalling only for the reason of too many Ads. The game itself is Great, but getting ADS even if you don't do anything in the game is too much.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Oh, that's a pity! We'll do our best to solve the problem in the shortest time possible. Stay tuned!

scraped_reviews.content: Ok here's the thing the game is actually great, love the different character playstyles. they make you feel like you could learn one you love and play in your own way. Now the but and this dropped it from a 5 star game to a 2 star game. the ads, every game has ads lately and whatever but when I hit the options button to change the sound and before I get to that menu I get an ad or get an ad at the start of a match then at the end of a match and one when I get back to the menu. It's too much!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey there! We're so glad you gave our game a chance. Keep playing :)

scraped_reviews.content: Well the game lied about being an offline game and as someone with limited internet access that's why I got it. It's an alright game simple nothing to difficult to grasp and is solid for a few hours. My biggest complaints are the fact that I can't play offline and it's littered with ads every game ad every thing I did an ad would follow i looked at the shop and got an ad it's honestly very annoying when you have limited time like.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! We feel sorry that you have issues. Could you please contact us via the email provided in the game and tell more about the problems you had? We would be very grateful to you for helping us to improve our game!

scraped_reviews.content: I actually enjoy the actual game. it's fun and simple but had enough variety to keep you in. BUT THE ADS!!! They ruin the entire thing. Just now I had to go through 9 pop ups and external ads before playing a single round. I probably play more of those ad games than the actual game and not by choice. I get why you need it but this was too much. Don't give me a good game just to barely let me play it
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Thank you for your input. It is important for us to receive feedback from our players because it allows us to improve the game. We will definitely listen to you. Carry on playing and stay tuned! :)

scraped_reviews.content: Its unplayable. They play so many ads it literally breaks the game. sucks because i remember playing this game a while ago and it wasnt this bad at all. you could get through a few matches without getting an ad. now, every time you start a match, end a match, collect your reward, and open a chest, there's an ad. took me 5 minutes to finish a level and the level itself only took 45 seconds. sellouts.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! We are glad you gave our game a chance. Thank you for reporting that bug to us, we'll fix it in the shortest time possible. Stay tuned!

scraped_reviews.content: Unplayable because of the ads. I had a sequence of playable ads that you couldn't go past without completing (took literally 5 minutes), then I was forced to watch a string of more ads to unlock a character, and I couldn't opt out of unlocking that character. The gameplay is fun and I used to play it all the time as a kid, but this is unacceptable now.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Thank you for your feedback. Our dev team is already working on that issue. Stay tuned for updates! Hope that you'll enjoy our game in the future :)

scraped_reviews.content: This game is very enjoyable, and would be a 5 star for me if not for the ADS! It is absolutely unbearable at times. You can't finish one level and start another without going through at least 2 ads. I understand apps make money off of ads but this game takes it to an extreme. Until this gets fixed, I won't be downloading it again.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! Our development team will definitely consider your opinion and make the game even better. Stay tuned for the updates! :)

scraped_reviews.content: This game used to be fun when it first came out, so simple and fun. Now, it is literally unplayable. It deserved 0/5 stars. As soon as you load into the game, you get around 4 pop ups. After a game, you get ads. Many characters that were once worth coins are now only available through buying them with real money. This game has become horrible.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Sorry to hear about that problem. Our development team will definitely consider the issue and make the game better. Thank you for your feedback!

scraped_reviews.content: there are way to many ads for this game to be enjoyable in any form, there's ads after every game, there's ads during you actually playing, it's every 10 seconds there's an ad, if you click any thing best believe you will have a ad, I've heard of aggressive marketing like this. but this is just sad, this developer puts this many ads to annoy people into paying for a subscription so there's not more ads and I've seen other games do this, but this by far is the absolute worst I've seen with this.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: It's very sad that you think so. We are working hard on improving our game. We are adding new content and different features regularly and minimizing the ads as possible to keep the app free and to have the possibility to work on it. We hope that you'll give another chance to our game. Stay tuned!

scraped_reviews.content: This is a game I played years ago as a kid. It showed up randomly while browsing, so I redownload it to have some fun and for nostalgia. Unfortunately after playing for no more than 15 minutes, I realized I was going to spend more time watching ads than enjoying the game. It's sad what the current state of this game is. Even if you aren't bombarded with a 30 second unskippable ad before or after each level, you might tap the huge banner ads that are present in every level. Completely unplayable.

This is so awesome. I mean I'm like, there is different levels which are zombies, island Royale, and bird hunting. What doesn't surprise me is that every single time I get a chest, most of the time, it is coins or gems and I can't even get even one single character from a chest. Overall great game. Oh yeah btw a little tip, if an ad pops up during a game or something, just exit out and then go back in. But if you want a second chance or like get into a masters league, ur gonna watch some ads. üò´

The game at its core is fun. That's all the positive things I have to say. The negatives, you will get an ad after every single action you take outside of gameplay. Press pause, ad. Press play, ad. Look away from the screen, ad. These are the predatory business practices that give mobile gaming a bad name. If I could rate the game lower, I would.

Bad controls. I think the protagonist being on the right, shooting left, would be better. Also, the ads and begging to spend money on their game are obnoxious. I don't need multiple pop-ups between each match. Just have a store and I'll visit if interested. The overall design of this game really hurts the experience. It's unnecessary and if your game is good... it'll make money. Calm down devs.

This game is super fun! but I will be uninstalling. I understand running ads so the devs can pay the bills. I generally don't mind paying to remove ads to support a game i enjoy, as I did with this game. But Holy hell fellas! Your in-app advertisements for additional in-game purchases is out of control. Before I'm even in the game, you're trying to sell me three different packages, and in between each match you're trying to get me to buy a subscription and/or more in-game purchases.

I remembered playing this game ages ago and decided to redownload it. What I found was highly disappointing. Literally everything is locked behind a paywall or ads. You can't do anything without watching an ad. Want to unlock a new character? Pay ten bucks. Want to take part in a special event? Ad. Want to play the game at all? Ad. It's stupid, they turned what was once a decent game into one where you can't do anything. Highly disappointing.

This game was really popular back then. But I can't stand this game anymore! There are ads 24/7. After a match, there's an ad. You could be browsing the menu and pressing back, there's an ad. There are just too many ads that make this game unplayable. And if you delete this game and reinstall it, say bye-bye to all your progression cuz they delete that. I learned that the hard way when I had nearly all the skins, but all those skins lost cuz I deleted it. Friendly tip: Don't spend money.

greed, a rather interesting topic. humans have a tendency to want more, despite having more than enough financial resources at their disposal. so you JUSTIFY wasting our time by flooding this game with ad after ad all in the name of free to play? ah but like I was saying before, GREED is a fundamental part of our anatomy. the game might look pretty, but on the inside it's rotten and i don't like the price of admission.

Don't get me wrong, it's a really fun game... but after every game, the app slaps an ads in your face. Not to mention some of its bugs or glitches, sometimes it lags out of nowhere and it could cost you the whole game. ALSO, some of the characters are locked behind a pay wall which sucks.. the rapper guy used to be my favorite and now I can't play him!

Played this game a long while back. It's good casual fun. Nowadays, I boot up the game, I'm berated by three $15+ micro transaction ads back to back, I close them, it offers to watch an ad for a reward, I deny, it forces a new mode into my face that I can't click off of, I'm then forced to click the mode, which then takes me to an immediate 30 second ad. This "game" genuinely makes you deal with more ad time than gameplay, and that is unforgivable.

First time ever leaving a review. The ads are insane. Literally, anything you click on will play an ad. From starting a level to completing a level. Will trick you into clicking on something that play ads. It even plays ads at the bottom of your screen while you play for 20 seconds and then makes you watch 2 minutes of ads. It's literally horrible. I'm surprised I didn't have to watch one to leave a review.

I love this game, but I always have to turn my Internet off to even slightly play it(,but that's because my phone sucks), this game is very dependent on ads and pay-to-play. You can eventually get at least half of the character's in this game, but then after you get all the characters that require coins, it's just luck based, and money based. The apple shooting and bird shooting characters won't unlock for me for some reason, even though I've almost played it 500 times. Besides that, good game!

Ads ads and more ads. Want to pause? Here's an add. In the middle of shooting birds with arrows before the level is over? Watch an ad. Want to even play a level? Watch an ad first. Want to get that new character? It'll take you a few days unless you watch some ads! Just so the creators know. I am deleting this game because the number of ads you put in pissed me off and made it so it was not fun to play.

You're gonna see a lot of spam. The game has tons of ads it'll get you with every time you do anything between screens. Then if you pay to remove ads, the game tries to up sell you like crazy! It's insane. Overall, great game, that I enjoy playing, in the moments I have time to blast a MF in the face with a spear! Well worth it. Job accomplished.

Greed kills games. Simple as that. We see it all the time in the industry. ads nonstop. No rewards. No, ryme, no reason. Just an ad every 30 seconds. If the developers even care anymore, you have killed this beautiful game. Just make the game 10 dollars on the app store. Don't bully people into paying 10 dollars to not see ads every 30 seconds.

Ok I loved this game when I was younger and it was so much fun, excpecially the two player ability is a blast with your friends and family. I 100% advise you to try this wholesome game out. But, the one thing that made my stars this low is the fact that they don't update their game! This game could be fantastic, but they NEVER add new characters to try out, or new levels, or game modes. This game could be perfect, only if they updated their game. They act like they don't care about their game :(

It's fun, quick-paced and free (with play pass). perfect fun, play at short bursts without losing any progress. There are multiple different minigames as well. Keeps you occupied, doesn't get boring. Edit: what I *really* like about it is that theyre continually updating it with new contests, and that I can pick it up, play for 3 minutes (0r 30!). The extra minigames/updates keep your attention, too. I just re-read my review and remembered I wrote that very quickly!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your positive review of our game! We're glad that you had a good time playing it, and we appreciate your suggestions for improvements. Your feedback is very helpful, and we'll definitely keep it in mind as we continue to develop the game.

scraped_reviews.content: I remember when this game used to be fun but now it's nothing more than it's formal empty shell than what it used to be. Fun, Quick, and the only times you would get an ad is to roll the chest or unlock a character. But now the game isn't fun anymore. Constant ads constantly asking you if you want to pay them for no add and if you want to buy premium and if you say no they back hand you with an ad and it‚Äôs always constant with the ads I can't even get into a game without seeing and ad

This game was the best offline game, but now, no joke they hit you with 5! Back to back purchasable items, ist bs. Then there's the ads, for example you used to be able to unlock chests with keys but now ist ads, ALOT OF ADS. They took of the offline part just so they could give you ADS. You used to be able to actually unlock character, but now every things locked behind a pay wall, don't believe me try it for 5 minutes. I don't recommend.

I think this is the first game that hasn't asked to be rated after the initial match.. Ok yes it's challenging, fun, entertaining, but the many variations of weaponry is off the charts. I'll leave that alone and let you discover them. The game itself is smooth running, easy controls, graphics are good. With Pass Play makes it even better. I usually play new games for about 30 min to get a good feel. I blinked and 1.5 hr passed by like nothing, great job devs!! 5‚≠ê

Starts up game "AD TIME". Then you have to navigate through the 4 pop-ups for season pass and other micro transactions. Then the game hopes you'll accidentally click on a player you don't have unlocked so it can play an add that can't be skipped. THEN you can select a level to play where you'll have a 50/50 chance of getting an add. AND ONLY THEN can you play a 30 second round of the same repetitive gameplay. Once that concludes GUESS WHAT....... "AD TIME". This app was made as an AD mill.

Decent game. There are a lot of ads like some other reviews have said, but that's how they keep the game free so I accept it - paying with time, so to speak. However, I made two purchases for my son's game and the app froze so we restarted after payment, now the rewards aren't there. It was around $5 total, so I'm not super upset, but my kiddo is, especially since I won't spend the money again. That's it, that's the rant.

The amount of ads required just to play the game is insane. The game isn't good enough to justify giving them any money, it's basically the exact same thing over and over again and it's not that difficult. There's better free options, with way less ads. And even if you think the ads aren't a big deal, they actually mess up gameplay. Ads start as you are pulling back the bow, Even after you watch the video to start the match, and makes you miss. Awful experience, do not download.

The ads are out of control. Typically I'm fine with ads when you finish a match or want to get bonus items but it's awful in this game. I clicked on the headshot game mode, decided I'd rather do the normal mode and swiped to go back. Boom hit with an ad. Clicked on the settings gear to exit. No exit button so I swiped back. Boom, another ad. Ok fine, what's the cost of going premium so I can get rid of these ads? $5? Maybe $10? No. It's $30. I'll just pay that for a PC game instead.

The gameplay is fun but there is a quite frankly disgusting amount of ads. The game is literally unplayable. You are forced to watch an ad to start a round, if you accidentally click any of the two annoying places ads in the match you have to sit through those and loose your shot. You want any chance at a decent reward, you guessed it, have to watch an ad. Oh, but you could remove the forced ad for $10.00 USD. I am only playing out of nostalgia, but it's quickly turning to disgust.

This game is a complete cash grab. After every single level, you're bombarded with ads and constant requests to buy packs, subscriptions, or a battle pass. If you decline watching a 60-second video for a "bonus," the game forces a random 10-second ad on you anyway. You constantly have to cancel out of multiple purchase prompts, only to be interrupted by more ads. The constant pressure to spend money and watch ads ruins the gameplay entirely. Avoid this game at all costs!

I stopped playing after around 10 minutes. Each game I played lasted about 1-3 minutes (games could last shorter if you're really good). But after every game I finished, there was an ad. This was really annoying to me. On the other hand, the gameplay and different abilities each character held was cool and unique. Overall, I would recommend this game to you if you didn't mind having many ads.

This used to be such a fun game to play a year or so ago, I played it again recently and the sheer amount of ads is horrendous. I can understand getting ads between matches, but wherever I pause in a game I get an ad when I resume. Sometimes I even get ads while I'm aiming(not even paused). I used to love this game, but now uts just frustrating. I'll probably uninstall and come back in a few months, but for now it's too irritating to play. If the amount of ads gets cut down I'll gladly 5 star

This has to be the most predatory game in the app store. 1. You can only do 1 battle or open 1 chest without seeing an ad. 2. The ads often hide the x to close in a weird spot or sometimes don't display them at all. I had to force close the app 3 times to get past ads that wouldn't close. 3. You can buy a premium sub which is $8 USD a week. A AAA MMO subscription is $15 a month. 4. You rarely get gems in the first part of the game. In 7 chests I received 1 gem. 5. It's all about ad watch.

The game itself is fine but there is way to many adds. Take two shots, a 30 second add pops up. Wanna get your reward, another add. If you don't want to see adds you have to pay 10-15 dollars which is hilarious. I should be able to enjoy the game a bit first before you blast me with ads every 10 seconds. I had to watch more ads than actually playing the game. Don't recommend

I used to love this game when I was younger. Now I can't even play because of the ads. Like, why are you stopping me mid game to give me a 30 sec ad while just giving me an ad before starting the game and then giving me another ad after ending the game and then forcing me to watch an add for extra rewards that I don't want and won't even get anyway? (They somehow manage to squeeze. more ads than the ones I talked about. Remember, this is EVERY round...)

There are way too many ads after buying add free. There is an almost constant stream of pop ups asking me to buy premium of packages or sales. I spend almost as much time clicking out of the offers as I do playing. And then, just to get your event rewards, you have to watch more ads. Since you are "choosing" to watch the ad, it is not covered by ad free. The game is ok, but having to slog through the constant pop ups and ruins it.

Sooooooo... before the game starts, it ask you to subscribe for $7.99 per WEEK without even knowing what the game is yet. Seems like they want you to forget that you subscribed and I bet customer service is trash. Played the tutorial round for about 20 seconds and was immediately thrown into an ad. You know one if those ads that won't let you click off for 30 seconds. I hate a game that makes you watch ads more than you actually play the game. Unistalled.

This game was good in the past but this game like many before it has fallen to enshitification, first of all the game now has very intrusive pop-ups for offers before you can even get into a game, as well as having highly intrusive advertisements not just before and after every level but sometimes during the levels themselves, and the weapon balancing is terrible with some characters having advantages as well as it being easy to put your opponent in a place where you can't hit them but they can

Just Ads. This game has great, goofy artwork, the gameplay is simple and fun, the unique characters and unique attacks are awesome. What does the developer do? Pump an ad every single end of match, charge TEN DOLLARS for a couple of ad skips, has pop ads to spend more money with them, etc. Etc. Dev, you had a great game here and you got greedy. Give this game to someone who is passionate about developing games for people to enjoy. You're clearly not that.

I use to play this game about 2-3 years ago, I'm 16 now and this game is still extremely fun to play! There is way to many ads so i just choose to play with my data off. I would like to support the creators and developers but $100 per year is highway robbery. Overall the characters are excellent, the gameplay is excellent, the prices ...absolute dog doo doo, but the mini games are fun and like I said you can just trun your data off so you don't get ads, so imma still give it 5 stars.

5 minutes in and it's like an ad every minute. And the 8 bucks a week for premium? So like 60 dollars after 2 months? And you think a mobile game is worth that much? I tried, I really tried. I wanted to get to the main menu and see if there was a cheaper ad free version but I couldn't even get to that because there was literally an ad after every level and every time you exited the start menu. You have angered me more than you have entertained me.

This game is fun, I find it fun, but this game is just JAM PACKED with Ads and Microtransactions. After you finish a round or two, or once you join the game, you're greeted with a few Microtransaction ads to get rid of certain things (No ads, VIP, and Starter pack (if your new?)), and after that, even more.. There's a giant premium button and no subscriptions button as well, which is pretty annoying. I can't fit that much in this review, but really; theres a lot of unnessi things, it's annoying.

Its a fine game but I deleted the game because it's slam full of ads. Start the game? Ad. Play 1 match? Ad. Accept the reward after the match? Ad. This game used to be great but it's been ruined with advertisements. I get that you guys wanna make money but forcing me to watch an ad every time I touch the screen is ridiculous. Anything you do will auto trigger an ad. I'd be fine with optional ads for rewards. It's not even that good of a game tbh. Pass on it, find something else.

title: Vinted: Shop & sell pre-loved
description:
The idea is simple: you sell your pre-loved stuff to other members who‚Äôll love it again. They get the thrill of unboxing a great find, you get more space at home. It's look-good, do-good, feel-good, for everyone. 

Selling is easy and free
Snap photos of your item, describe it, and set your price. You keep 100% of what you earn.  
‚Ä¢ Cash in on your pre-loved clothes and more. 
‚Ä¢ Watch your earnings grow. Send your money straight to your bank account. 
‚Ä¢ Buyers cover shipping costs. You get prepaid labels that make things simple. 

Shop new-again finds 				
Feel proud of your second-hand discoveries, from clothes to accessories. 
‚Ä¢ Fast finds, long-lasting love. There‚Äôs a Vinted category for almost everything, use filters to speed up shopping. 
‚Ä¢ We‚Äôve got your back. When you buy on Vinted, we cover you with Buyer Protection. For a small fee, you‚Äôll get a refund if your item is lost, damaged in delivery, or significantly not as described. 
‚Ä¢ Choose a shipping carrier and have your order sent to your home or a convenient pickup location.  

There‚Äôs a diverse community of second-hand enthusiasts waiting to meet you. Chat with your fellow members, get updates, and manage your orders all in one place. 

Come join us
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@vinted 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/vinted
Find out more in our Help Center: https://www.vinted.com/help

summary: Join a community of millions of members buying and selling second-hand items.

scraped_reviews.content: The marketplace itself is well designed with good filters and search. But the purchasing experience leaves much to be desired as it usually fails several times before actually going through. My last purchase took ~3 days of submitting payment before it didn't report a generic "payment failed" message. And don't even bother contacting customer support; they will give you canned answers from their FAQ and then just ignore you if that answer doesn't work.

I've had this app for about 2 weeks. so far I love the ease of listing and that there are no seller fees. One thing that is nerve-racking though is that out of the 4 sales I've made, only one shipping label has been easy to print. The other three kept giving error messages for days before it finally let me print it. I sell on other platforms too and take pride in shipping quickly so having issues printing shipping labels for days was not a great experience.

Full of Scams- BEWARE.Lots of sellers with no reviews and no pfp. Selling name brand items sometimes at too good to be true prices. Vinted also is awful at resolving issues. They never get back to you, and rely too much on the seller's word. If you purchase an item from a scammer, it will eventually even give you a tracking notification, with a number. However, the item will never ship to you, and the tracking updates won't make any sense. Have to wait over 30 days to report as "lost" üôÑ

I like the app. It's easy to search for categories. However I would really appreciate a Google Lens type search feature. If I'm looking for something very specific (eg: if I broke my favourite dress) it can be so hard. People just put "lovely top" with no detail. If I could search for images to find closest matches to what I want I believe it would help buyers and sellers make more transactions

I absolutely adore this app/platform. It is so easy to list an item for sale. No hassle and no fees. As for buying, I don't mind paying the buyer protection fee (it's minimal). It has been of massive benefit when parcels have gone missing or there has been an issue (thankfully only a few times). I haven't encountered any glitches as of yet. If I do, I am sure they will be sorted quickly. Love it üòä‚ù§Ô∏è

shockingly awful! I've been selling online for 25 years now and have used many different sites and this is by far the worst! I've been using this site for less than a month and I've had more problems with it then all the years I've been selling combined!! It's worth it to pay fees elsewhere to avoid all the massive frustration and lost time this one will cause. I've got an order and I can't even fulfill it because I can't even get a shipping label. Nonexistent help as well.

Grateful for this application. I took a bit of time to start and wish I had much earlier. Vinted is an easy to use app with safety at the forefront and I value this. I love the process of selling and knowing pieces that I have loved will go onto someone new and not in landfills. There are areas for improvement, like cropping photos when you take them live on the app-but, it seems Vinted listens to feedback. We are downsizing -home and bodies! So, making a bit of extra money too is a bonus!

Terrible for buyers. 1- If the seller describes the product inaccurately, buyer still has to pay for the item to be shipped back (even though they've been deceived). 2- if a parcel gets lost, buyer only has 2 days to ask for a refund. 3- I've reported two sellers who are clearly deceiving the buyers (one actually wrote in the description that transactions HAVE to take place outside the app) and Vinted replies to me saying "no issue found".

i wish i could give a higher score, because the idea behind it is great and i try to buy all my clothes second-hand. but unfortunately, recently the AI generated images that show a false state of the item (mainly in sizes, AI has no idea how 4XL or 5XL looks) infested the site and vinted does nothing to stop it, despite the policy being against such slop. the customer support is barely there, very inconsistent, and even after deleting a listing with AI, the seller can just repost it again

a good way to get nice clothes for cheap prices. however Vinted is not helpful as far as shipping and delivery issues are concerned. Vinted also does not always match the actual status of the parcels and they are discrepancies between Vinted notifications and the shipping company notifications. I got one item lost , another one dropped off at the wrong place, another item was marked as picked up when I never picked it up, to find out later that the drop off point had changed.

I really liked this App, but the newest update really got on my nerves. I've sold and bought many things, but they took away the Rating feature for 'non-system/vinted-transactions' aka if you sell an Item via a different option (in persona, PayPal...) you can't rate the person. Also here in Germany there's way more and cheaper packaging options than in the app, which is pretty annoying. You also can't really give discounts as easily as before. Update: there's no filter option for countries :/

Great way to sell and buy clothes, really easy to upload items, and I like that fees are on the buyer rather than the seller. The search function is quite good except when looking at all the items for sale by a particular seller - when they have dozens/hundreds of items for sale it makes it hard to find what you're looking for but I do like to bundle items to save on postage.

Overall great app, I bought and sold loads of things without much issue. However the recent app updates actually made it worse. For example why is the brand not tappable anymore? I want to be able to click on the brand of an item to see more from that brand instead of going through a whole search process for it. Also miss the "similar items" feature which was really helpful. I never understand why developers take features away from an otherwise good app. Don't fix what isn't broken.

I have removed a star because the update isn't working well. I get notifications for sales that completed 5 days ago when there are no more actions to take. I am inundated with notifications for nothing. The messages section needs to be sorted into active sales and purchases, with other messages in another area. A great place for buying second hand clothes. The filters work brilliantly and I love how it starts to understand what you're looking for and shows you up-to-date recommendations.

Giving sellers a week to post is ridiculous! Most sellers I've encountered are untrustworthy or make up some excuses as to why they can no longer sell the item and the buyer (me) has to wait until the seller has decided if they can be arsed to post it or not using the week to do nothing, leaving me out of pocket for a week only to have the order cancelled by the seller. 3 working days Is enough to post an item, it's enough to walk from Manchester to London so it's enough time to post an item.

Like many, many others (that I've since learned about), my account has been permanently banned from Vinted. I was in the middle of two sales of household items and I lost the money. It seemed like a nice platform and there are many nice people using it, but the administration is completely flawed and customer service is non existent. Personally, I would recommend avoiding this. Update: They didn't even answer my appeal. I've been reading many horrible experiences. My final word, BOYCOTT VINTED.

I like vinted for what you can find on there but the app is extremely poor. the new 'recommended' homepage is completely unusable, I clicked on one single pair of hoka trainers once for less than 30 seconds and now my entire homepage is hoka trainers even if I scroll through hundreds of items and close the app and reopen again. the 'favourites' is now only accessible via a menu when it used to be directly accessible. I really don't recommend it unless you know exactly what you want to purchase.

It would be REALLY good if there was an option to select multiple/all messages to delete instead of doing one a time, its so tedious. also would really nice to have the option of viewing in dark mode, when im doomed scrolling listings late at night, i prefer not to light the room up & burn my retinas (yes i have already adjusted my brightness settings) and the "investigation" process for a lost parcel takes WAAAAAY TOO LONG, i mean seriously, 6 weeks for a ¬£3.73 refund.

The app has become so buggy recently, which is a little concerning when it contains sensitive information like bank details and addresses. I sold an item on a different platform, so tried to mark it as sold on Vinted, but it wouldn't let me. I kept getting a 'something went wrong, please try again later' message, which is no use to anyone because if someone buys the listing within that time, i have to cancel the order and that affects my shop rating. I ended up just having to delete the listing

The new changes they made since Oktober 1st made the app apparently more safe for both buyers and sellers. The buyer can only choose insured shipping. But I wish they would make it possible for the sellers to choose the shipping company, I don't have a car and I can't always travel 30 minutes to be able to ship a package I'm selling for 5‚Ç¨. I Also don't want to have to ship or buy form outside of Germany. And if you report fake accounts they do nothing and you can't delete the chat for 6 months.

AI automated rubbish from customer service! I created an account through my Facebook login. Bought an item. Next day I added items I wanted to sell. ALL second hand bits from my wardrobe. Nothing expensive or counterfeit. Sold 4 items. The vinted decided this was somehow fraudulent activity and shut my account down. Won't say why. Asked for some stupid photos and when I asked what the problem was, they said since you haven't sent photos we're blocking indefinitely! No mention of a refund!!

scam festival. decent if you buy and sell cheap items as there are plenty of second hand items on the market. sadly, for expensive items (especially if you're selling) people will try to scam you left right and center. someone claimed the item wasn't as good as described and wanted 50% off and keep the item, one claimed that the item was damaged and that I sent it damaged, another one that the item I sent was different. all in 4 transaction. plus, vinted doesn't care. shop at your own risk.

Vinted is a great way to buy and sell second hand items but when something goes wrong with an order more often than not the buyer loses out in some way, financially or through time wasted. the support team are mostly useless and either don't read your messages properly, reply with template messages or maybe they're AI? great when it works, awful when it doesn't.

Have used app for a while and thought it was great. Following update yesterday. A number of things seem to have disappeared in addition to the postage options already mentioned in other reviews. I now can't find an option to set up bundles, put to holiday mode which I used to do when I was going to be away and not available to post sales and no help button. This makes the app really unusable so will be deleting anything for sale if this doesn't get resolved in the next few days.

Lots of people order and don't collect the item meaning wasted lots of time and money posting packages that don't get collected. No money recouped for packaging that is wasted. I reported someone who does this a lot and was told they can not do anything. Lots of counterfeit items so be careful, very much like ebay with all the shops popping up. Closed my account and donated the items as not worth messing about for a couple of pounds. Also, my settings kept turning French, which is odd?

Absolutely awful experience. Made an account which for some reason automatically put me in the US, so it was impossible for me to sell anything, you can't change country EVEN THOUGH THERE'S AN OPTION FOR IT, support won't do it either, so I was forced to make a new email just to make a new account, which then got banned after a day for 'fraudulent activity' because it detected duplicated listings, because of the original US account, which btw I REMOVED, horrible app go elsewhere.

I downloaded Vinted after trying Wallpop and suffering from their horrible customer service team. This app has been a great discovery, it allows you to browse through a broad selection of articles in different parts of Europe. The shipping costs are relatively cheap and the app includes many options to customise your experience which is greatly appreciated. The app will maintain you informed throughout the whole shipping process For me this is the best app to buy or sell I give it a 10/10

I found it great for buying my bear clothes and other bits. but some things aren't categorised, so the same thing could be listed has several different things. you can't just use your local Postal service, or select what you can get to. sizing is weird XL is class has a 14 where has to me it's around a 18-22 depending on make, so I am afraid to buy clothes. measurement is in inches üò≠, (I work in CMs not inches). I don't think app geared to English users, with inches and weird sizing.

Brilliant way to declutter and increase sustainability.. Best features. 1. Easy to upload. 2. Prepaid postage 3. orders page 4. Very easy to withdraw balance l5. Encourages sustainability.... features which could improve 1. After a few days your items are less likely to get favourite or sold (this seems to have been improved with the new star wardrobe feature although everyone seems to have a star wardrobe, even those with no reviews). 2. Fees for cheap items make expensive and not worth buying
It's good for what it is. Buying and selling. Fixed the verification issue by getting someone else to let me use their phone. Not ideal.

I've been a customer since 2019! I sold many items with an average 5-star rating. Three months ago and for the 1st time ever, one of my packages was stated "damaged" by Mondial Relais (which I find sketchy anyway, because I always pack the items to perfection). I try to reach Vinted support and it has been impossible to find a solution. They keep me 2 months in waiting. So much for client support when you need one... Bummer!

It was all fine until I wanted to add my bank account to transfer money to. I don't receive the email verification. I've bought also on vinted, that was fine?! Warning! After contacting vinted countless times, they constantly add new requirements to reply with and they deny every single one of them so you are not able to add your bank to get your own money. support is terrible. they don't want to do their work, are lazy, and behave worse than Ai chats from 10 years ago.

What was a great app has now gone downhill with the recent updates of women's clothing in the UK. None of the new sizes correlate with my listings. Like other people have said, unless it's fixed, I will have to sell elsewhere. Trying to search for things is just as confusing. I've tried to look for something this evening and nothing is searchable. I'd like to think it's because the sizing issue is being fixed...

The recent changes to the sizing has ruined this app. The sizing is confusing, limited and makes buying and selling much harder and frustrating. It is a huge change meaning you have to check and edit all your listings, and wasn't communicated at all!! I found out about it via news stories about how angry users are. I will think twice now about using Vinted as it so annoying and Jas really put me off.

Where is the customer service? When problems arise it would be handy to have access to a live chat that's helpful. instead of recommendation answers that do not help. It's very difficult. also, when listing items, vinted ends up deleting and prohibiting them, but then someone can list the same thing and be fine. its really annoying as you say if it happens to much, our account can be banned, but I myself didn't list anything on the banned catalogue. it then declines the appeal.

It's a good app, easy to list and I've found that I've made a lot more sales than using eBay. However be expected to sell for less than expected unless you've got designer goods. Additionally, it can take many days to receive payment. Firstly your buyer has to receive your item then they have to confirm there's no issues with it, then you have to wait 2 days for the payment to reach your balance; then finally you have to transfer the balance to your bank which can take up to another 5 days.

Experiance has been great so far. Haven't had any problems sending or receiving. The app is easy to navigate and very easy to understand when it comes to sending stuff as well. The only issue I have is well, it's more of an annoyance, really. I find that the mailbox can be very messy. I would like a separate option in the inbox for people who have bought from me. Just so I can keep them separate from things I'm buying as I have found myself getting confused trying to find the write mail

It could be a very useful app, but sadly it doesn't perform as one would wish for. I have received items that were wrongly advertised, wrong sizing etc. and still is the seller who decides if they take it back and if you pay the postage or not (obviously, they always make you pay). After sometime using it, I got burnt out. Not that cheap in the long run...

When it works it's really great, good way to sell unwanted items. But it is full of glitches and issues, every week there is something not working, from lack of tracking of packages to delays in payment of money owing to the seller. Worst of all is the customer service, it seems to be run by bots and it's really difficult to sort out an issue. Their word is law on any decision, despite providing proof and they ban your account making accusations with no evidence. Use with caution.

While I admit that Vinted has been a life changer and easy to use, it lacks a lot of options that I wish were there, like ignoring certain brands or sellers. It should also be easier to look for items than it is, as now you need to know details of an item if you want to find the said item, for example the brand name, which isn't always possible. Also Vinted's own postal service is god awful.

It's a good app for casual selling and buying, but if you run into problems (and if you sell a lot you will) the support is awful. The AI support is dreadful. It takes 2 days for a human to answer and the answer is usually auto-filled and the help is 0. Example: A buyer didn't pick up the package I delivered and I had to pay for the return, Vinted didn't agree there was a problem with that. I got no refund for the return fee. The buyer got all their money back, including the delivery fee.

Very good app, easier and faster to list items on than eBay. The biggest negative is that Vinted updates regularly without any warning to users. Something changes almost weekly that you weren't expecting. Many of these updates also cause errors/bugs. The most common error is a newly listed item not showing up when people search for it. It takes several hours until they fix it. I've often searched all items on Vinted for it to show the newest item was listed 6 hours ago

I like the app, it's well done and stable. I still find it outrageous the fee that they inflict on everybody without offering proper buyer protection because if there is a return of a bad described (faulty) product, seller and buyer still have to agree who pays the return transport which for me is a problem. But overall I had mostly good experience with the app and transactions and its still cheaper than buying new stuff. The option "similar products" is good but needs further improvement.

I'd like to point attention to the BLATANT DISREGARD OF CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE with this app. I can't count the times where I "accidentally" click on an ad anymore. Basically it's once eeru 10 listings or so. The ad takes more than half of the view on the page, making it extremely impossible to not touch it, and then you're immediately transfered to the landing page of the ad. For other application, at least i can swiggle around to not touch the ads but this one, it's impossible. I find it scummy

What is happening with the pending balance issue? I have made lots of money on Vinted but cant withdraw or spend to buy something. Its been showing on my account for over 2 weeks and the customer service doesn't seem to care? Overall its a great app but some sellers are scammers. I had bought some items that were never sent, no communication too, however Vinted returned the money quickly. I will change my rating once the pending balance issue is sorted. Its really frustrating.

I enjoyed Vinted a lot more before the recent update that clubs two different sizes together (eg. 12-14), making it really hard to browse/ locate the actual right size. There wasn't any need for this change and, as a buyer, it's made trusting that I'm buying something that will fit me FAR harder. Add in that some sizes are now randomly logged as other sizes, and it's just a mess. I don't know that I would recommend the app to friends now the way I did previously, given this update.

Up until today, I have loved this app. Really easy to buy and sell. However, today the women's listings are all showing as the same size regardless of actual size and searching for your size doesn't work. I see the way in which sizes are listed has changed. It is now much more difficult to find the size I want. It is not specific enough. Very off-putting and not sure I want to be bothered using the app anymore.

Can't use app because first you have to verify your email. The verification codes never arrived. Sent an email from that account to ask customer support if they can override it, as clearly my email is valid and I am the owner. No can do - if their codes don't arrive, the only option is to use a different email address. Absurd! Used a different email, managed to create an account. Location was set by default as USA, even though I am in Europe. One can't change location! Unable to use, basically.

Unfortunately the terms and conditions seem to make it easy for fraudulent behavior. I lost 60‚Ç¨ to a seller who was trying to lure me into paying more money to "be able to actually send the product" that I already paid for. The service is a catastrophe and only responds in pre-written messages, stating that they can't do anything. There is no willingness to find a solution for a specific issue. Will never use the app again and will warn my friends.

Easy to use, quick and straightforward. so far all my transactions as a buyer or seller (ca. 20) have been problem-free. Great way to find new homes for unwanted possessions or pick up bargains and, most importantly, reduce waste. Occasionally glitchy and sometimes lacks appropriate categories for items.
